FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the enzymatic amplification (PCR, TMA, NASBA) of specific nucleic acids

FIELD.LABEL: library size
FIELD.NAME: library size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project

FIELD.LABEL: library reads sequenced
FIELD.NAME: library reads sequenced
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones sequenced from the library

FIELD.LABEL: library construction method
FIELD.NAME: library construction method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Library construction method used for clone libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library vector
FIELD.NAME: library vector
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Cloning vector type(s) used in construction of libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library screening strategy
FIELD.NAME: library screening strategy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating clone libraries in order to select a specific group of sequences

FIELD.LABEL: target gene
FIELD.NAME: target gene
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies

FIELD.LABEL: target subfragment
FIELD.NAME: target subfragment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to e.g. identify special regions on marker genes like V6 on 16S rRNA

FIELD.LABEL: pcr primers
FIELD.NAME: pcr primers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.NAME: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Molecular barcodes, called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: adapters
FIELD.NAME: adapters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: pcr conditions
FIELD.NAME: pcr conditions
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of reaction conditions and components for PCR in the form of 'initial denaturation:94degC_1.5min; annealing=...'

FIELD.LABEL: sequencing method
FIELD.NAME: sequencing method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequencing machine used. Where possible the term should be taken from the OBI list of DNA sequencers (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0400103).

FIELD.LABEL: sequence quality check
FIELD.NAME: sequence quality check
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms). Applied only for sequences that are not submitted to SRA or DRA

FIELD.LABEL: chimera check software
FIELD.NAME: chimera check software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool(s) used for chimera checking, including version number and parameters, to discover and remove chimeric sequences. A chimeric sequence is comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences.

FIELD.LABEL: relevant electronic resources
FIELD.NAME: relevant electronic resources
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise associated to the sequence in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

FIELD.LABEL: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.NAME: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Standard operating procedures used in assembly and/or annotation of genomes, metagenomes or environmental sequences in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

FIELD.LABEL: negative control type
FIELD.NAME: negative control type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The substance or equipment used as a negative control in an investigation

FIELD.LABEL: positive control type
FIELD.NAME: positive control type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The substance, mixture, product, or apparatus used to verify that a process which is part of an investigation delivers a true positive.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Collection event information

FIELD.LABEL: collection date
FIELD.NAME: collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The date of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

FIELD.LABEL: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.NAME: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: local environmental context
FIELD.NAME: local environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for "broad-scale environmental context". Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: environmental medium
FIELD.NAME: environmental medium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: source material identifiers
FIELD.NAME: source material identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).

FIELD.LABEL: sample material processing
FIELD.NAME: sample material processing
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A brief description of any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment, or a link to the relevant protocol(s) performed.

FIELD.LABEL: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.NAME: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material. Mandatory for MIGS and MIMARKS Specimen.

FIELD.LABEL: propagation
FIELD.NAME: propagation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of reproduction from the parent stock. Values for this field is specific to different taxa. For phage or virus: lytic/lysogenic/temperate/obligately lytic. For plasmids: incompatibility group. For eukaryotes: sexual/asexual. Mandatory for MIGs of eukayotes, plasmids and viruses.

FIELD.LABEL: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.NAME: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected.

FIELD.LABEL: host body product
FIELD.NAME: host body product
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: substance produced by the body, e.g. stool, mucus, where the sample was obtained from. For Foundational Model of Anatomy Ontology (FMA) (v 3.1) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/FMA

FIELD.LABEL: medical history performed
FIELD.NAME: medical history performed
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: whether full medical history was collected

FIELD.LABEL: oxygenation status of sample
FIELD.NAME: oxygenation status of sample
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: oxygenation status of sample

FIELD.LABEL: organism count
FIELD.NAME: organism count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr)

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage duration
FIELD.NAME: sample storage duration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: duration for which sample was stored

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage temperature
FIELD.NAME: sample storage temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage location
FIELD.NAME: sample storage location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection device
FIELD.NAME: sample collection device
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The device used to collect an environmental sample. It is recommended to use terms listed under environmental sampling device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO) and/or terms listed under specimen collection device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0002094).

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection method
FIELD.NAME: sample collection method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method employed for collecting the sample. Can be provided in the form of a PMID, DOI, url or text.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host disorder

FIELD.LABEL: dermatology disorder
FIELD.NAME: dermatology disorder
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: History of dermatology disorders; can include multiple disorders. The terms should be chosen from the DO (Human Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, skin disease (https://disease-ontology.org/?id=DOID:37).

FIELD.LABEL: host disease status
FIELD.SYNONYM: health or disease status of specific host
FIELD.NAME: host disease status
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: list of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from DO (Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, other hosts are free text

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host description

FIELD.LABEL: host subject id
FIELD.NAME: host subject id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: a unique identifier by which each subject can be referred to, de-identified, e.g. #131

FIELD.LABEL: IHMC medication code
FIELD.NAME: IHMC medication code
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: can include multiple medication codes

FIELD.LABEL: host age
FIELD.NAME: host age
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: age of host at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees

FIELD.LABEL: host body site
FIELD.NAME: host body site
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: name of body site where the sample was obtained from, such as a specific organ or tissue (tongue, lung etc...). For Foundational Model of Anatomy Ontology (FMA) (v 3.1) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/FMA

FIELD.LABEL: host height
FIELD.NAME: host height
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the height of subject

FIELD.LABEL: host body-mass index
FIELD.NAME: host body-mass index
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: body mass index, calculated as weight/(height)squared

FIELD.LABEL: ethnicity
FIELD.NAME: ethnicity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A category of people who identify with each other, usually on the basis of presumed similarities such as a common language, ancestry, history, society, culture, nation or social treatment within their residing area. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_contemporary_ethnic_groups

FIELD.LABEL: host occupation
FIELD.NAME: host occupation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: most frequent job performed by subject

FIELD.LABEL: host total mass
FIELD.NAME: host total mass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total mass of the host at collection, the unit depends on host

FIELD.LABEL: host phenotype
FIELD.NAME: host phenotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: phenotype of host. For Phenotypic quality Ontology (PATO) (v 2013-10-28) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

FIELD.LABEL: host body temperature
FIELD.NAME: host body temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: core body temperature of the host when sample was collected

FIELD.LABEL: host sex
FIELD.NAME: host sex
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Gender or sex of the host.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions

FIELD.LABEL: temperature
FIELD.NAME: temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature of the sample at time of sampling

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: concentration measurement

FIELD.LABEL: salinity
FIELD.NAME: salinity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total concentration of all dissolved salts in a liquid or solid sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host details

FIELD.LABEL: time since last wash
FIELD.NAME: time since last wash
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: specification of the time since last wash

FIELD.LABEL: dominant hand
FIELD.NAME: dominant hand
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: dominant hand of the subject

FIELD.LABEL: host diet
FIELD.NAME: host diet
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: type of diet depending on the host, for animals omnivore, herbivore etc., for humans high-fat, Mediterranean etc.; can include multiple diet types

FIELD.LABEL: host last meal
FIELD.NAME: host last meal
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: content of last meal and time since feeding; can include multiple values

FIELD.LABEL: host family relationship
FIELD.NAME: host family relationship
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: relationships to other hosts in the same study; can include multiple relationships

FIELD.LABEL: host genotype
FIELD.NAME: host genotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: observed genotype

FIELD.LABEL: host pulse
FIELD.NAME: host pulse
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: resting pulse, measured as beats per minute

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: organism characteristics

FIELD.LABEL: subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.NAME: subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Information about the genetic distinctness of the sequenced organism below the subspecies level, e.g., serovar, serotype, biotype, ecotype, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. Subspecies should not be recorded in this term, but in the NCBI taxonomy. Supply both the lineage name and the lineage rank separated by a colon, e.g., biovar:abc123.

FIELD.LABEL: trophic level
FIELD.NAME: trophic level
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Trophic levels are the feeding position in a food chain. Microbes can be a range of producers (e.g. chemolithotroph)

FIELD.LABEL: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.NAME: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments

FIELD.LABEL: known pathogenicity
FIELD.NAME: known pathogenicity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: To what is the entity pathogenic, for instance plant, fungi, bacteria

FIELD.LABEL: encoded traits
FIELD.NAME: encoded traits
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Should include key traits like antibiotic resistance or xenobiotic degradation phenotypes for plasmids, converting genes for phage

FIELD.LABEL: observed biotic relationship
FIELD.NAME: observed biotic relationship
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is it free-living or in a host and if the latter what type of relationship is observed

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions imposed

FIELD.LABEL: chemical administration
FIELD.NAME: chemical administration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v111), please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/CHEBI

FIELD.LABEL: perturbation
FIELD.NAME: perturbation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: GSC MIxS human vaginal
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: GSC MIxS human vaginal
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: Genomic Standards Consortium package extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from the environment where the sample was obtained. By choosing the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from a relevant subsets of the GSC terms.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: non-sample terms

FIELD.LABEL: project name
FIELD.NAME: project name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized

FIELD.LABEL: experimental factor
FIELD.NAME: experimental factor
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Experimental factors are essentially the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI). For a browser of EFO (v 2.95) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/EFO; for a browser of OBI (v 2018-02-12) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI. E.g. time series design [EFO:EFO_0001779]

FIELD.LABEL: ploidy
FIELD.NAME: ploidy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly). For terms, please select terms listed under class ploidy (PATO:001374) of Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), and for a browser of PATO (v 2018-03-27) please refer to http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

FIELD.LABEL: number of replicons
FIELD.NAME: number of replicons
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes, bacteria, archaea and segmented virus.

FIELD.LABEL: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.NAME: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Do plasmids exist of significant phenotypic consequence (e.g. ones that determine virulence or antibiotic resistance). Megaplasmids? Other plasmids (borrelia has 15+ plasmids).

FIELD.LABEL: estimated size
FIELD.NAME: estimated size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The estimated size of the genome (in bp) prior to sequencing. Of particular importance in the sequencing of (eukaryotic) genome which could remain in draft form for a long or unspecified period. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes.

FIELD.LABEL: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.NAME: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Primary publication if isolated before genome publication; otherwise, primary genome report. Mandatory for MIGS of bacteria and archaea.

FIELD.LABEL: annotation source
FIELD.NAME: annotation source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For cases where annotation was provided by a community jamboree or model organism database rather than by a specific submitter

FIELD.LABEL: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.NAME: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Volume (ml) or mass (g) of total collected sample processed for DNA extraction. Note: total sample collected should be entered under the term 'sample size'.

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the material separation to recover the nucleic acid fraction from a sample

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the enzymatic amplification (PCR, TMA, NASBA) of specific nucleic acids

FIELD.LABEL: library size
FIELD.NAME: library size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project

FIELD.LABEL: library reads sequenced
FIELD.NAME: library reads sequenced
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones sequenced from the library

FIELD.LABEL: library construction method
FIELD.NAME: library construction method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Library construction method used for clone libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library vector
FIELD.NAME: library vector
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Cloning vector type(s) used in construction of libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library screening strategy
FIELD.NAME: library screening strategy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating clone libraries in order to select a specific group of sequences

FIELD.LABEL: target gene
FIELD.NAME: target gene
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies

FIELD.LABEL: target subfragment
FIELD.NAME: target subfragment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to e.g. identify special regions on marker genes like V6 on 16S rRNA

FIELD.LABEL: pcr primers
FIELD.NAME: pcr primers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.NAME: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Molecular barcodes, called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: adapters
FIELD.NAME: adapters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: pcr conditions
FIELD.NAME: pcr conditions
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of reaction conditions and components for PCR in the form of 'initial denaturation:94degC_1.5min; annealing=...'

FIELD.LABEL: sequencing method
FIELD.NAME: sequencing method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequencing machine used. Where possible the term should be taken from the OBI list of DNA sequencers (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0400103).

FIELD.LABEL: sequence quality check
FIELD.NAME: sequence quality check
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms). Applied only for sequences that are not submitted to SRA or DRA

FIELD.LABEL: chimera check software
FIELD.NAME: chimera check software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool(s) used for chimera checking, including version number and parameters, to discover and remove chimeric sequences. A chimeric sequence is comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences.

FIELD.LABEL: relevant electronic resources
FIELD.NAME: relevant electronic resources
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise associated to the sequence in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

FIELD.LABEL: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.NAME: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Standard operating procedures used in assembly and/or annotation of genomes, metagenomes or environmental sequences in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

FIELD.LABEL: negative control type
FIELD.NAME: negative control type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The substance or equipment used as a negative control in an investigation

FIELD.LABEL: positive control type
FIELD.NAME: positive control type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The substance, mixture, product, or apparatus used to verify that a process which is part of an investigation delivers a true positive.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Collection event information

FIELD.LABEL: collection date
FIELD.NAME: collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The date of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

FIELD.NAME: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: oxygenation status of sample

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage duration
FIELD.NAME: sample storage duration

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage temperature
FIELD.NAME: sample storage temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage location
FIELD.NAME: sample storage location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection device
FIELD.NAME: sample collection device
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The device used to collect an environmental sample. It is recommended to use terms listed under environmental sampling device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO) and/or terms listed under specimen collection device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0002094).

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection method
FIELD.NAME: sample collection method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method employed for collecting the sample. Can be provided in the form of a PMID, DOI, url or text.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host disorder

FIELD.LABEL: gynecological disorder
FIELD.NAME: gynecological disorder
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: History of gynecological disorders; can include multiple disorders. The terms should be chosen from the DO (Human Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, female reproductive system disease (https://disease-ontology.org/?id=DOID:229).

FIELD.LABEL: urogenital disorder
FIELD.NAME: urogenital disorder
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: History of urogenital disorders, can include multiple disorders. The terms should be chosen from the DO (Human Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, reproductive system disease (https://disease-ontology.org/?id=DOID:15) or urinary system disease (https://disease-ontology.org/?id=DOID:18).

FIELD.LABEL: host disease status
FIELD.SYNONYM: health or disease status of specific host
FIELD.NAME: host disease status
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: list of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from DO (Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, other hosts are free text

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host description

FIELD.LABEL: host subject id
FIELD.NAME: host subject id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: a unique identifier by which each subject can be referred to, de-identified, e.g. #131

FIELD.LABEL: IHMC medication code
FIELD.NAME: IHMC medication code
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: can include multiple medication codes

FIELD.LABEL: host age
FIELD.NAME: host age
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: age of host at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees

FIELD.LABEL: host body site
FIELD.NAME: host body site
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: name of body site where the sample was obtained from, such as a specific organ or tissue (tongue, lung etc...). For Foundational Model of Anatomy Ontology (FMA) (v 3.1) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/FMA

FIELD.LABEL: host height
FIELD.NAME: host height
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the height of subject

FIELD.LABEL: host body-mass index
FIELD.NAME: host body-mass index
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: body mass index, calculated as weight/(height)squared

FIELD.LABEL: ethnicity
FIELD.NAME: ethnicity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A category of people who identify with each other, usually on the basis of presumed similarities such as a common language, ancestry, history, society, culture, nation or social treatment within their residing area. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_contemporary_ethnic_groups

FIELD.LABEL: host occupation
FIELD.NAME: host occupation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: most frequent job performed by subject

FIELD.LABEL: host total mass
FIELD.NAME: host total mass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total mass of the host at collection, the unit depends on host

FIELD.LABEL: host phenotype
FIELD.NAME: host phenotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: phenotype of host. For Phenotypic quality Ontology (PATO) (v 2013-10-28) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

FIELD.LABEL: host body temperature
FIELD.NAME: host body temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: core body temperature of the host when sample was collected

FIELD.LABEL: host sex
FIELD.NAME: host sex
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Gender or sex of the host.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions

FIELD.LABEL: temperature
FIELD.NAME: temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature of the sample at time of sampling

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: concentration measurement

FIELD.LABEL: salinity
FIELD.NAME: salinity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total concentration of all dissolved salts in a liquid or solid sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host details

FIELD.LABEL: menarche
FIELD.NAME: menarche
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: date of most recent menstruation

FIELD.LABEL: sexual activity
FIELD.NAME: sexual activity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: current sexual partner and frequency of sex

FIELD.LABEL: pregnancy
FIELD.NAME: pregnancy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: date due of pregnancy

FIELD.LABEL: douche
FIELD.NAME: douche
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: date of most recent douche

FIELD.LABEL: birth control
FIELD.NAME: birth control
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: specification of birth control medication used

FIELD.LABEL: menopause
FIELD.NAME: menopause
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: date of onset of menopause

FIELD.LABEL: HRT
FIELD.NAME: HRT
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: whether subject had hormone replacement theraphy, and if yes start date

FIELD.LABEL: hysterectomy
FIELD.NAME: hysterectomy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: specification of whether hysterectomy was performed

FIELD.LABEL: host diet
FIELD.NAME: host diet
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: type of diet depending on the host, for animals omnivore, herbivore etc., for humans high-fat, Mediterranean etc.; can include multiple diet types

FIELD.LABEL: host last meal
FIELD.NAME: host last meal
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: content of last meal and time since feeding; can include multiple values

FIELD.LABEL: host family relationship
FIELD.NAME: host family relationship
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: relationships to other hosts in the same study; can include multiple relationships

FIELD.LABEL: host genotype
FIELD.NAME: host genotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: observed genotype

FIELD.LABEL: host pulse
FIELD.NAME: host pulse
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: resting pulse, measured as beats per minute

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: organism characteristics

FIELD.LABEL: subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.NAME: subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Information about the genetic distinctness of the sequenced organism below the subspecies level, e.g., serovar, serotype, biotype, ecotype, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. Subspecies should not be recorded in this term, but in the NCBI taxonomy. Supply both the lineage name and the lineage rank separated by a colon, e.g., biovar:abc123.

FIELD.LABEL: trophic level
FIELD.NAME: trophic level
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Trophic levels are the feeding position in a food chain. Microbes can be a range of producers (e.g. chemolithotroph)

FIELD.LABEL: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.NAME: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments

FIELD.LABEL: known pathogenicity
FIELD.NAME: known pathogenicity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: To what is the entity pathogenic, for instance plant, fungi, bacteria

FIELD.LABEL: encoded traits
FIELD.NAME: encoded traits
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Should include key traits like antibiotic resistance or xenobiotic degradation phenotypes for plasmids, converting genes for phage

FIELD.LABEL: observed biotic relationship
FIELD.NAME: observed biotic relationship
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is it free-living or in a host and if the latter what type of relationship is observed

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions imposed

FIELD.LABEL: chemical administration
FIELD.NAME: chemical administration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v111), please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/CHEBI

FIELD.LABEL: perturbation
FIELD.NAME: perturbation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: GSC MIxS microbial mat biolfilm
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: GSC MIxS microbial mat biolfilm
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: Genomic Standards Consortium package extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from the environment where the sample was obtained. By choosing the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from a relevant subsets of the GSC terms.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: non-sample terms

FIELD.LABEL: project name
FIELD.NAME: project name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized

FIELD.LABEL: experimental factor
FIELD.NAME: experimental factor
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Experimental factors are essentially the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI). For a browser of EFO (v 2.95) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/EFO; for a browser of OBI (v 2018-02-12) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI. E.g. time series design [EFO:EFO_0001779]

FIELD.LABEL: ploidy
FIELD.NAME: ploidy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly). For terms, please select terms listed under class ploidy (PATO:001374) of Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), and for a browser of PATO (v 2018-03-27) please refer to http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

FIELD.LABEL: number of replicons
FIELD.NAME: number of replicons
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes, bacteria, archaea and segmented virus.

FIELD.LABEL: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.NAME: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Do plasmids exist of significant phenotypic consequence (e.g. ones that determine virulence or antibiotic resistance). Megaplasmids? Other plasmids (borrelia has 15+ plasmids).

FIELD.LABEL: estimated size
FIELD.NAME: estimated size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The estimated size of the genome (in bp) prior to sequencing. Of particular importance in the sequencing of (eukaryotic) genome which could remain in draft form for a long or unspecified period. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes.

FIELD.LABEL: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.NAME: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Primary publication if isolated before genome publication; otherwise, primary genome report. Mandatory for MIGS of bacteria and archaea.

FIELD.LABEL: annotation source
FIELD.NAME: annotation source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For cases where annotation was provided by a community jamboree or model organism database rather than by a specific submitter

FIELD.LABEL: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.NAME: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Volume (ml) or mass (g) of total collected sample processed for DNA extraction. Note: total sample collected should be entered under the term 'sample size'.

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the material separation to recover the nucleic acid fraction from a sample

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the enzymatic amplification (PCR, TMA, NASBA) of specific nucleic acids

FIELD.LABEL: library size
FIELD.NAME: library size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project

FIELD.LABEL: library reads sequenced
FIELD.NAME: library reads sequenced
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones sequenced from the library

FIELD.LABEL: library construction method
FIELD.NAME: library construction method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Library construction method used for clone libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library vector
FIELD.NAME: library vector
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Cloning vector type(s) used in construction of libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library screening strategy
FIELD.NAME: library screening strategy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating clone libraries in order to select a specific group of sequences

FIELD.LABEL: target gene
FIELD.NAME: target gene
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies

FIELD.LABEL: target subfragment
FIELD.NAME: target subfragment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to e.g. identify special regions on marker genes like V6 on 16S rRNA

FIELD.LABEL: pcr primers
FIELD.NAME: pcr primers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.NAME: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Molecular barcodes, called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: adapters
FIELD.NAME: adapters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: pcr conditions
FIELD.NAME: pcr conditions
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of reaction conditions and components for PCR in the form of 'initial denaturation:94degC_1.5min; annealing=...'

FIELD.LABEL: sequencing method
FIELD.NAME: sequencing method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequencing machine used. Where possible the term should be taken from the OBI list of DNA sequencers (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0400103).

FIELD.LABEL: sequence quality check
FIELD.NAME: sequence quality check
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms). Applied only for sequences that are not submitted to SRA or DRA

FIELD.LABEL: chimera check software
FIELD.NAME: chimera check software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool(s) used for chimera checking, including version number and parameters, to discover and remove chimeric sequences. A chimeric sequence is comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences.

FIELD.LABEL: relevant electronic resources
FIELD.NAME: relevant electronic resources
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise associated to the sequence in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

FIELD.LABEL: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.NAME: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Standard operating procedures used in assembly and/or annotation of genomes, metagenomes or environmental sequences in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

FIELD.LABEL: negative control type
FIELD.NAME: negative control type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The substance or equipment used as a negative control in an investigation

FIELD.LABEL: positive control type
FIELD.NAME: positive control type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The substance, mixture, product, or apparatus used to verify that a process which is part of an investigation delivers a true positive.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Collection event information

FIELD.LABEL: collection date
FIELD.NAME: collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The date of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

FIELD.LABEL: altitude
FIELD.NAME: altitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

FIELD.LABEL: depth
FIELD.NAME: depth
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The vertical distance below local surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.

FIELD.LABEL: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.NAME: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: local environmental context
FIELD.NAME: local environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for "broad-scale environmental context". Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: environmental medium
FIELD.NAME: environmental medium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).

FIELD.LABEL: elevation
FIELD.NAME: elevation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: source material identifiers
FIELD.NAME: source material identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).

FIELD.LABEL: sample material processing
FIELD.NAME: sample material processing
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A brief description of any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment, or a link to the relevant protocol(s) performed.

FIELD.LABEL: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.NAME: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material. Mandatory for MIGS and MIMARKS Specimen.

FIELD.LABEL: propagation
FIELD.NAME: propagation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of reproduction from the parent stock. Values for this field is specific to different taxa. For phage or virus: lytic/lysogenic/temperate/obligately lytic. For plasmids: incompatibility group. For eukaryotes: sexual/asexual. Mandatory for MIGs of eukayotes, plasmids and viruses.

FIELD.LABEL: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.NAME: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected.

FIELD.LABEL: biomass
FIELD.NAME: biomass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: amount of biomass; should include the name for the part of biomass measured, e.g. microbial, total. can include multiple measurements

FIELD.LABEL: oxygenation status of sample
FIELD.NAME: oxygenation status of sample
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: oxygenation status of sample

FIELD.LABEL: organism count
FIELD.NAME: organism count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr)

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage duration
FIELD.NAME: sample storage duration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: duration for which sample was stored

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage temperature
FIELD.NAME: sample storage temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage location
FIELD.NAME: sample storage location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection device
FIELD.NAME: sample collection device
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The device used to collect an environmental sample. It is recommended to use terms listed under environmental sampling device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO) and/or terms listed under specimen collection device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0002094).

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection method
FIELD.NAME: sample collection method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method employed for collecting the sample. Can be provided in the form of a PMID, DOI, url or text.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host disorder

FIELD.LABEL: host disease status
FIELD.SYNONYM: health or disease status of specific host
FIELD.NAME: host disease status
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: list of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from DO (Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, other hosts are free text

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host description

FIELD.LABEL: host scientific name
FIELD.NAME: host scientific name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Scientific name of the natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which sample was obtained.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions

FIELD.LABEL: alkalinity
FIELD.NAME: alkalinity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate

FIELD.LABEL: mean friction velocity
FIELD.NAME: mean friction velocity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of mean friction velocity

FIELD.LABEL: mean peak friction velocity
FIELD.NAME: mean peak friction velocity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of mean peak friction velocity

FIELD.LABEL: pressure
FIELD.NAME: pressure
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: pressure to which the sample is subject, in atmospheres

FIELD.LABEL: temperature
FIELD.NAME: temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature of the sample at time of sampling

FIELD.LABEL: turbidity
FIELD.NAME: turbidity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: turbidity measurement

FIELD.LABEL: pH
FIELD.NAME: pH
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: pH measurement

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: concentration measurement

FIELD.LABEL: alkyl diethers
FIELD.NAME: alkyl diethers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of alkyl diethers

FIELD.LABEL: aminopeptidase activity
FIELD.NAME: aminopeptidase activity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of aminopeptidase activity

FIELD.LABEL: ammonium
FIELD.NAME: ammonium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of ammonium

FIELD.LABEL: bacterial carbon production
FIELD.NAME: bacterial carbon production
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of bacterial carbon production

FIELD.LABEL: bishomohopanol
FIELD.NAME: bishomohopanol
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of bishomohopanol

FIELD.LABEL: bromide
FIELD.NAME: bromide
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of bromide

FIELD.LABEL: calcium
FIELD.NAME: calcium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of calcium

FIELD.LABEL: carbon/nitrogen ratio
FIELD.NAME: carbon/nitrogen ratio
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: ratio of amount or concentrations of carbon to nitrogen

FIELD.LABEL: chloride
FIELD.NAME: chloride
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of chloride

FIELD.LABEL: chlorophyll
FIELD.NAME: chlorophyll
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of chlorophyll

FIELD.LABEL: diether lipids
FIELD.NAME: diether lipids
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of diether lipids; can include multiple types of diether lipids

FIELD.LABEL: dissolved carbon dioxide
FIELD.NAME: dissolved carbon dioxide
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of dissolved carbon dioxide

FIELD.LABEL: dissolved hydrogen
FIELD.NAME: dissolved hydrogen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of dissolved hydrogen

FIELD.LABEL: dissolved inorganic carbon
FIELD.NAME: dissolved inorganic carbon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: dissolved inorganic carbon concentration

FIELD.LABEL: dissolved organic carbon
FIELD.NAME: dissolved organic carbon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of dissolved organic carbon

FIELD.LABEL: dissolved organic nitrogen
FIELD.NAME: dissolved organic nitrogen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: dissolved organic nitrogen concentration measured as; total dissolved nitrogen - NH4 - NO3 - NO2

FIELD.LABEL: methane
FIELD.NAME: methane
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: methane (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

FIELD.LABEL: dissolved oxygen
FIELD.NAME: dissolved oxygen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of dissolved oxygen

FIELD.LABEL: glucosidase activity
FIELD.NAME: glucosidase activity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of glucosidase activity

FIELD.LABEL: magnesium
FIELD.NAME: magnesium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of magnesium

FIELD.LABEL: n-alkanes
FIELD.NAME: n-alkanes
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of n-alkanes; can include multiple n-alkanes

FIELD.LABEL: nitrate
FIELD.NAME: nitrate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of nitrate

FIELD.LABEL: nitrite
FIELD.NAME: nitrite
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of nitrite

FIELD.LABEL: nitrogen
FIELD.NAME: nitrogen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of nitrogen (total)

FIELD.LABEL: organic carbon
FIELD.NAME: organic carbon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of organic carbon

FIELD.LABEL: organic matter
FIELD.NAME: organic matter
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of organic matter

FIELD.LABEL: organic nitrogen
FIELD.NAME: organic nitrogen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of organic nitrogen

FIELD.LABEL: particulate organic carbon
FIELD.NAME: particulate organic carbon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of particulate organic carbon

FIELD.LABEL: petroleum hydrocarbon
FIELD.NAME: petroleum hydrocarbon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of petroleum hydrocarbon

FIELD.LABEL: phaeopigments
FIELD.NAME: phaeopigments
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of phaeopigments; can include multiple phaeopigments

FIELD.LABEL: phosphate
FIELD.NAME: phosphate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of phosphate

FIELD.LABEL: phospholipid fatty acid
FIELD.NAME: phospholipid fatty acid
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of phospholipid fatty acids; can include multiple values

FIELD.LABEL: potassium
FIELD.NAME: potassium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of potassium

FIELD.LABEL: redox potential
FIELD.NAME: redox potential
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: redox potential, measured relative to a hydrogen cell, indicating oxidation or reduction potential

FIELD.LABEL: salinity
FIELD.NAME: salinity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total concentration of all dissolved salts in a liquid or solid sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater.

FIELD.LABEL: total carbon
FIELD.NAME: total carbon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total carbon content

FIELD.LABEL: silicate
FIELD.NAME: silicate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of silicate

FIELD.LABEL: sodium
FIELD.NAME: sodium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: sodium concentration

FIELD.LABEL: total organic carbon
FIELD.NAME: total organic carbon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Definition for soil: total organic C content of the soil units of g C/kg soil. Definition otherwise: total organic carbon content

FIELD.LABEL: water content
FIELD.NAME: water content
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: water content measurement

FIELD.LABEL: sulfate
FIELD.NAME: sulfate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of sulfate

FIELD.LABEL: sulfide
FIELD.NAME: sulfide
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: concentration of sulfide

FIELD.LABEL: total nitrogen
FIELD.NAME: total nitrogen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total nitrogen content of the sample

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: organism characteristics

FIELD.LABEL: subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.NAME: subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Information about the genetic distinctness of the sequenced organism below the subspecies level, e.g., serovar, serotype, biotype, ecotype, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. Subspecies should not be recorded in this term, but in the NCBI taxonomy. Supply both the lineage name and the lineage rank separated by a colon, e.g., biovar:abc123.

FIELD.LABEL: trophic level
FIELD.NAME: trophic level
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Trophic levels are the feeding position in a food chain. Microbes can be a range of producers (e.g. chemolithotroph)

FIELD.LABEL: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.NAME: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments

FIELD.LABEL: known pathogenicity
FIELD.NAME: known pathogenicity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: To what is the entity pathogenic, for instance plant, fungi, bacteria

FIELD.LABEL: encoded traits
FIELD.NAME: encoded traits
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Should include key traits like antibiotic resistance or xenobiotic degradation phenotypes for plasmids, converting genes for phage

FIELD.LABEL: observed biotic relationship
FIELD.NAME: observed biotic relationship
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is it free-living or in a host and if the latter what type of relationship is observed

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions imposed

FIELD.LABEL: chemical administration
FIELD.NAME: chemical administration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v111), please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/CHEBI

FIELD.LABEL: perturbation
FIELD.NAME: perturbation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: GSC MIxS plant associated
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: GSC MIxS plant associated
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: Genomic Standards Consortium package extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from the environment where the sample was obtained. By choosing the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from a relevant subsets of the GSC terms.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: non-sample terms

FIELD.LABEL: project name
FIELD.NAME: project name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized

FIELD.LABEL: experimental factor
FIELD.NAME: experimental factor
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Experimental factors are essentially the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI). For a browser of EFO (v 2.95) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/EFO; for a browser of OBI (v 2018-02-12) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI. E.g. time series design [EFO:EFO_0001779]

FIELD.LABEL: ploidy
FIELD.NAME: ploidy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly). For terms, please select terms listed under class ploidy (PATO:001374) of Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), and for a browser of PATO (v 2018-03-27) please refer to http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

FIELD.LABEL: number of replicons
FIELD.NAME: number of replicons
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes, bacteria, archaea and segmented virus.

FIELD.LABEL: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.NAME: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Do plasmids exist of significant phenotypic consequence (e.g. ones that determine virulence or antibiotic resistance). Megaplasmids? Other plasmids (borrelia has 15+ plasmids).

FIELD.LABEL: estimated size
FIELD.NAME: estimated size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The estimated size of the genome (in bp) prior to sequencing. Of particular importance in the sequencing of (eukaryotic) genome which could remain in draft form for a long or unspecified period. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes.

FIELD.LABEL: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.NAME: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Primary publication if isolated before genome publication; otherwise, primary genome report. Mandatory for MIGS of bacteria and archaea.

FIELD.LABEL: annotation source
FIELD.NAME: annotation source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For cases where annotation was provided by a community jamboree or model organism database rather than by a specific submitter

FIELD.LABEL: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.NAME: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Volume (ml) or mass (g) of total collected sample processed for DNA extraction. Note: total sample collected should be entered under the term 'sample size'.

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the material separation to recover the nucleic acid fraction from a sample

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the enzymatic amplification (PCR, TMA, NASBA) of specific nucleic acids

FIELD.LABEL: library size
FIELD.NAME: library size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project

FIELD.LABEL: library reads sequenced
FIELD.NAME: library reads sequenced
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones sequenced from the library

FIELD.LABEL: library construction method
FIELD.NAME: library construction method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Library construction method used for clone libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library vector
FIELD.NAME: library vector
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Cloning vector type(s) used in construction of libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library screening strategy
FIELD.NAME: library screening strategy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating clone libraries in order to select a specific group of sequences

FIELD.LABEL: target gene
FIELD.NAME: target gene
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies

FIELD.LABEL: target subfragment
FIELD.NAME: target subfragment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to e.g. identify special regions on marker genes like V6 on 16S rRNA

FIELD.LABEL: pcr primers
FIELD.NAME: pcr primers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.NAME: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Molecular barcodes, called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: adapters
FIELD.NAME: adapters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: pcr conditions
FIELD.NAME: pcr conditions
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of reaction conditions and components for PCR in the form of 'initial denaturation:94degC_1.5min; annealing=...'

FIELD.LABEL: sequencing method
FIELD.NAME: sequencing method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequencing machine used. Where possible the term should be taken from the OBI list of DNA sequencers (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0400103).

FIELD.LABEL: sequence quality check
FIELD.NAME: sequence quality check
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms). Applied only for sequences that are not submitted to SRA or DRA

FIELD.LABEL: chimera check software
FIELD.NAME: chimera check software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool(s) used for chimera checking, including version number and parameters, to discover and remove chimeric sequences. A chimeric sequence is comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences.

FIELD.LABEL: relevant electronic resources
FIELD.NAME: relevant electronic resources
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise associated to the sequence in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

FIELD.LABEL: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.NAME: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Standard operating procedures used in assembly and/or annotation of genomes, metagenomes or environmental sequences in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

FIELD.LABEL: negative control type
FIELD.NAME: negative control type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The substance or equipment used as a negative control in an investigation

FIELD.LABEL: positive control type
FIELD.NAME: positive control type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The substance, mixture, product, or apparatus used to verify that a process which is part of an investigation delivers a true positive.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Collection event information

FIELD.LABEL: collection date
FIELD.NAME: collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The date of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

FIELD.LABEL: altitude
FIELD.NAME: altitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

FIELD.LABEL: depth
FIELD.NAME: depth
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The vertical distance below local surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.

FIELD.LABEL: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.NAME: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: local environmental context
FIELD.NAME: local environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for "broad-scale environmental context". Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: environmental medium
FIELD.NAME: environmental medium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).

FIELD.LABEL: elevation
FIELD.NAME: elevation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: source material identifiers
FIELD.NAME: source material identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).

FIELD.LABEL: sample material processing
FIELD.NAME: sample material processing
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A brief description of any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment, or a link to the relevant protocol(s) performed.

FIELD.LABEL: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.NAME: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material. Mandatory for MIGS and MIMARKS Specimen.

FIELD.LABEL: propagation
FIELD.NAME: propagation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of reproduction from the parent stock. Values for this field is specific to different taxa. For phage or virus: lytic/lysogenic/temperate/obligately lytic. For plasmids: incompatibility group. For eukaryotes: sexual/asexual. Mandatory for MIGs of eukayotes, plasmids and viruses.

FIELD.LABEL: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.NAME: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected.

FIELD.LABEL: host dry mass
FIELD.NAME: host dry mass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of dry mass

FIELD.LABEL: oxygenation status of sample
FIELD.NAME: oxygenation status of sample
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: oxygenation status of sample

FIELD.LABEL: plant product
FIELD.NAME: plant product
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: substance produced by the plant, where the sample was obtained from

FIELD.LABEL: organism count
FIELD.NAME: organism count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr)

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage duration
FIELD.NAME: sample storage duration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: duration for which sample was stored

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage temperature
FIELD.NAME: sample storage temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

FIELD.LABEL: host wet mass
FIELD.NAME: host wet mass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of wet mass

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage location
FIELD.NAME: sample storage location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection device
FIELD.NAME: sample collection device
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The device used to collect an environmental sample. It is recommended to use terms listed under environmental sampling device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO) and/or terms listed under specimen collection device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0002094).

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection method
FIELD.NAME: sample collection method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method employed for collecting the sample. Can be provided in the form of a PMID, DOI, url or text.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host disorder

FIELD.LABEL: host disease status
FIELD.SYNONYM: health or disease status of specific host
FIELD.NAME: host disease status
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: list of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from DO (Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, other hosts are free text

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host description

FIELD.LABEL: host common name
FIELD.NAME: host common name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: common name of the host, e.g. human

FIELD.LABEL: host age
FIELD.NAME: host age
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: age of host at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees

FIELD.LABEL: host taxid
FIELD.NAME: host taxid
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: NCBI taxon id of the host, e.g. 9606

FIELD.LABEL: host life stage
FIELD.NAME: host life stage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: description of life stage of host

FIELD.LABEL: host height
FIELD.NAME: host height
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the height of subject

FIELD.LABEL: host length
FIELD.NAME: host length
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the length of subject

FIELD.LABEL: plant body site
FIELD.NAME: plant body site
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: name of body site that the sample was obtained from. For Plant Ontology (PO) (v 20) terms, see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PO

FIELD.LABEL: host total mass
FIELD.NAME: host total mass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total mass of the host at collection, the unit depends on host

FIELD.LABEL: host phenotype
