FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the strain from which the sample was obtained.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Associated host information
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Information regarding the data which is host associated

FIELD.LABEL: host habitat
FIELD.NAME: host habitat
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Natural habitat of the avian or mammalian host.

FIELD.LABEL: isolation source host-associated
FIELD.NAME: isolation source host-associated
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of host tissue or organ sampled for analysis. Example: tracheal tissue

FIELD.LABEL: host description
FIELD.NAME: host description
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Other descriptive information relating to the host.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host details

FIELD.LABEL: gravidity
FIELD.NAME: gravidity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not the subject is gravid. If so, report date due or date post-conception and specify which of these two dates is being reported.

FIELD.LABEL: host behaviour
FIELD.NAME: host behaviour
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Natural behaviour of the host.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Environmental information
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Environmental information if not host associated.

FIELD.LABEL: isolation source non-host-associated
FIELD.NAME: isolation source non-host-associated
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived. Example: soil

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: ENA Tara Oceans
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: ENA Tara Oceans
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: Minimum information about a Tara Oceans sample. A checklist for reporting metadata of oceanic plankton samples associated with genomics data from the Tara Oceans Expedition.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Marine Event

FIELD.LABEL: Event Label
FIELD.NAME: Event Label
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An Event corresponds to the deployment of a sampling device. It is bound in space and time. The Event Label is a unique identifier composed of the project prefix "TARA", sampling date/time "yyyymmddThh:mm:ssZ", station number "000" and a short label to indicate the sampling device used, e.g. "EVENT_CAST", "EVENT_NET", "EVENT_PUMP". Example: TARA_20110416T1508Z_100_EVENT_CAST.

FIELD.LABEL: Event Date/Time Start
FIELD.NAME: Event Date/Time Start
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Date and time in UTC when the sampling event started, e.g. each CTD cast, net tow, or bucket collection is a distinct event. Format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ. Example: 2011-04-16T15:05:30Z.

FIELD.LABEL: Event Date/Time End
FIELD.NAME: Event Date/Time End
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Date and time in UTC when the sampling event ended, e.g. each CTD cast, net tow, or bucket collection is a distinct event. Format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ. Example: 2011-04-16T15:38:00Z.

FIELD.LABEL: Latitude Start
FIELD.NAME: Latitude Start
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Latitude of the location where the sampling event started, e.g. each CTD cast, net tow, or bucket collection is a distinct event. Format: ##.####, Decimal degrees; North= +, South= -; Use WGS 84 for GPS data. Example: -24.6666.

FIELD.LABEL: Longitude Start
FIELD.NAME: Longitude Start
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Longitude of the location where the sampling event started, e.g. each CTD cast, net tow, or bucket collection is a distinct event. Format: ###.####, Decimal degrees; East= +, West= -; Use WGS 84 for GPS data. Example: -096.1012.

FIELD.LABEL: Latitude End
FIELD.NAME: Latitude End
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Latitude of the location where the sampling event ended, e.g. each CTD cast, net tow, or bucket collection is a distinct event. Format: ##.####, Decimal degrees; North= +, South= -; Use WGS 84 for GPS data. Example: -24.6643.

FIELD.LABEL: Longitude End
FIELD.NAME: Longitude End
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Longitude of the location where the sampling event ended, e.g. each CTD cast, net tow, or bucket collection is a distinct event. Format: ###.####, Decimal degrees; East= +, West= -; Use WGS 84 for GPS data. Example: -096.1171.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Marine Sample

FIELD.LABEL: Depth
FIELD.NAME: Depth
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The distance below the surface of the water at which a measurement was made or a sample was collected. Format: ####.##, Positive below the sea surface. SDN:P06:46:ULAA for m. Example: 14.71

FIELD.LABEL: Sample Collection Device
FIELD.NAME: Sample Collection Device
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The sampling device(s) used for the Event. Example: CTD(sbe9C)/Rosette with Niskin bottles.

FIELD.LABEL: Protocol Label
FIELD.NAME: Protocol Label
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifies the protocol used to produce the sample, e.g. filtration and preservation. Example: BACT_NUC_W0.22-1.6.

FIELD.LABEL: Size Fraction Lower Threshold
FIELD.NAME: Size Fraction Lower Threshold
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: SAMPLE_PROTOCOL_Size-Fraction_Lower-Threshold_(µm) indicates the lower size threshold. Materials smaller than the size threshold are excluded from the sample. Example: 0.22 µm

FIELD.LABEL: Size Fraction Upper Threshold
FIELD.NAME: Size Fraction Upper Threshold
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: SAMPLE_PROTOCOL_Size-Fraction_Upper-Threshold_(µm) indicates the upper size threshold. Materials larger than the size threshold are excluded from the sample.Example: 1.6 µm

FIELD.LABEL: Sample Status
FIELD.NAME: Sample Status
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Refers to the completness of sample metadata validation. Example: preliminary but can be used to provide data discovery services.

FIELD.LABEL: Last Update Date
FIELD.NAME: Last Update Date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Date of the last update of this sample in the SAMPLES REGISTRY. Example: 2014-03-01Z.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: non-sample terms

FIELD.LABEL: project name
FIELD.NAME: project name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Collection event information

FIELD.LABEL: environmental package
FIELD.NAME: environmental package
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: MIGS/MIMS/MIMARKS extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from one or more of the environments where the sample was obtained. All environmental packages listed here are further defined in separate subtables. By giving the name of the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from the subtables and can be reported

FIELD.LABEL: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.NAME: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: local environmental context
FIELD.NAME: local environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for "broad-scale environmental context". Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: environmental medium
FIELD.NAME: environmental medium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Marine Sampling

FIELD.LABEL: Sampling Campaign
FIELD.NAME: Sampling Campaign
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Refers to a finite or indefinite activity aiming at collecting data/samples, e.g. a cruise, a time series, a mesocosm experiment. Example: TARA_20110401Z.

FIELD.LABEL: Sampling Station
FIELD.NAME: Sampling Station
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Refers to the site/station where data/sample collection is performed. Example: TARA_100.

FIELD.LABEL: Sampling Platform
FIELD.NAME: Sampling Platform
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Refers to the unique stage from which the sampling device has been deployed. Includes Platform category from SDN:L06, http://seadatanet.maris2.nl/v_bodc_vocab_v2/search.asp?lib=L06, and Platform name. Example: Research Vessel Tara.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Marine Environment

FIELD.LABEL: Marine Region
FIELD.NAME: Marine Region
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the marine region name chosen from the Marine Regions vocabulary at http://www.marineregions.org/. Example: Aegean Sea.

FIELD.LABEL: Salinity Sensor
FIELD.NAME: Salinity Sensor
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Salinity of water at the time of taking the sample. Format: ##.####, SDN:P02:75:PSAL, SDN:P06:46:UGKG for PSU. Example: 39.2268.

FIELD.LABEL: Oxygen Sensor
FIELD.NAME: Oxygen Sensor
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Oxygen concentration parameters in the water column measured in volts and converted to micromoles per kilogrammes. Format: ###.####, SDN:P02:75:DOXY, SDN:P06:46:KGUM for µmol/kg. Example: 217.7895.

FIELD.LABEL: Nitrate Sensor
FIELD.NAME: Nitrate Sensor
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Nitrate concentration parameters in the water column measured in volts and converted to micromoles per litres. Format: ##.####, SDN:P02:75:NTRA, SDN:P06:46:UPOX for µmol/L. Example: 0.2259.

FIELD.LABEL: Temperature
FIELD.NAME: Temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Temperature of water at the time of taking the sample. Format: ##.####, SDN:P02:75:TEMP, SDN:P06:46:UPAA for °C. Example: 17.7122.

FIELD.LABEL: Chlorophyll Sensor
FIELD.NAME: Chlorophyll Sensor
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Fluorescence of the water measured in volts and converted to milligrammes of chlorophyll per cubic metre. Format: ##.####, SDN:P02:75:CPWC, SDN:P06:46:UMMC for mg Chl/m3. Example: 0.066.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Reference

FIELD.LABEL: Citation
FIELD.NAME: Citation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Citation of the Sample Registry (HTML version) at the PANGAEA. Example: doi.pangaea.de/10.1594/PANGAEA.76752.

FIELD.LABEL: Further Details
FIELD.NAME: Further Details
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference details related to a sample in form of an URI.

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: GSC MIxS built environment
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: GSC MIxS built environment
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: Genomic Standards Consortium package extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from the environment where the sample was obtained. By choosing the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from a relevant subsets of the GSC terms.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: non-sample terms

FIELD.LABEL: project name
FIELD.NAME: project name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized

FIELD.LABEL: experimental factor
FIELD.NAME: experimental factor
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Experimental factors are essentially the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI). For a browser of EFO (v 2.95) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/EFO; for a browser of OBI (v 2018-02-12) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI. E.g. time series design [EFO:EFO_0001779]

FIELD.LABEL: ploidy
FIELD.NAME: ploidy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly). For terms, please select terms listed under class ploidy (PATO:001374) of Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), and for a browser of PATO (v 2018-03-27) please refer to http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

FIELD.LABEL: number of replicons
FIELD.NAME: number of replicons
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes, bacteria, archaea and segmented virus.

FIELD.LABEL: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.NAME: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Do plasmids exist of significant phenotypic consequence (e.g. ones that determine virulence or antibiotic resistance). Megaplasmids? Other plasmids (borrelia has 15+ plasmids).

FIELD.LABEL: estimated size
FIELD.NAME: estimated size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The estimated size of the genome (in bp) prior to sequencing. Of particular importance in the sequencing of (eukaryotic) genome which could remain in draft form for a long or unspecified period. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes.

FIELD.LABEL: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.NAME: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Primary publication if isolated before genome publication; otherwise, primary genome report. Mandatory for MIGS of bacteria and archaea.

FIELD.LABEL: annotation source
FIELD.NAME: annotation source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For cases where annotation was provided by a community jamboree or model organism database rather than by a specific submitter

FIELD.LABEL: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.NAME: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Volume (ml) or mass (g) of total collected sample processed for DNA extraction. Note: total sample collected should be entered under the term 'sample size'.

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the material separation to recover the nucleic acid fraction from a sample

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the enzymatic amplification (PCR, TMA, NASBA) of specific nucleic acids

FIELD.LABEL: library size
FIELD.NAME: library size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project

FIELD.LABEL: library reads sequenced
FIELD.NAME: library reads sequenced
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones sequenced from the library

FIELD.LABEL: library construction method
FIELD.NAME: library construction method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Library construction method used for clone libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library vector
FIELD.NAME: library vector
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Cloning vector type(s) used in construction of libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library screening strategy
FIELD.NAME: library screening strategy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating clone libraries in order to select a specific group of sequences

FIELD.LABEL: target gene
FIELD.NAME: target gene
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies

FIELD.LABEL: target subfragment
FIELD.NAME: target subfragment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to e.g. identify special regions on marker genes like V6 on 16S rRNA

FIELD.LABEL: pcr primers
FIELD.NAME: pcr primers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.NAME: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Molecular barcodes, called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: adapters
FIELD.NAME: adapters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: pcr conditions
FIELD.NAME: pcr conditions
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of reaction conditions and components for PCR in the form of 'initial denaturation:94degC_1.5min; annealing=...'

FIELD.LABEL: sequencing method
FIELD.NAME: sequencing method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequencing machine used. Where possible the term should be taken from the OBI list of DNA sequencers (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0400103).

FIELD.LABEL: sequence quality check
FIELD.NAME: sequence quality check
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms). Applied only for sequences that are not submitted to SRA or DRA

FIELD.LABEL: chimera check software
FIELD.NAME: chimera check software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool(s) used for chimera checking, including version number and parameters, to discover and remove chimeric sequences. A chimeric sequence is comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences.

FIELD.LABEL: relevant electronic resources
FIELD.NAME: relevant electronic resources
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise associated to the sequence in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

FIELD.LABEL: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.NAME: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Standard operating procedures used in assembly and/or annotation of genomes, metagenomes or environmental sequences in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

FIELD.LABEL: negative control type
FIELD.NAME: negative control type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The substance or equipment used as a negative control in an investigation

FIELD.LABEL: positive control type
FIELD.NAME: positive control type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The substance, mixture, product, or apparatus used to verify that a process which is part of an investigation delivers a true positive.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Collection event information

FIELD.LABEL: collection date
FIELD.NAME: collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The date of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

FIELD.LABEL: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.NAME: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: local environmental context
FIELD.NAME: local environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for "broad-scale environmental context". Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: environmental medium
FIELD.NAME: environmental medium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: internal environment

FIELD.LABEL: surface material
FIELD.NAME: surface material
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: surface materials at the point of sampling

FIELD.LABEL: surface air contaminant
FIELD.NAME: surface air contaminant
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: contaminant identified on surface

FIELD.LABEL: indoor surface
FIELD.NAME: indoor surface
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: type of indoor surface

FIELD.LABEL: indoor space
FIELD.NAME: indoor space
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: a distinguishable space within a structure, the purpose for which discrete areas of a building is used

FIELD.LABEL: filter type
FIELD.NAME: filter type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: a device which removes solid particulates or airborne molecular contaminants

FIELD.LABEL: heating and cooling system type
FIELD.NAME: heating and cooling system type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: methods of conditioning or heating a room or building

FIELD.LABEL: substructure type
FIELD.NAME: substructure type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the substructure or under building is that largely hidden section of the building which is built off the foundations to the ground floor level

FIELD.LABEL: light type
FIELD.NAME: light type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: application of light to achieve some practical or aesthetic effect. Lighting includes the use of both artificial light sources such as lamps and light fixtures, as well as natural illumination by capturing daylight. Can also include absence of light

FIELD.LABEL: building setting
FIELD.NAME: building setting
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: a location (geography) where a building is set

FIELD.LABEL: building occupancy type
FIELD.NAME: building occupancy type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the primary function for which a building or discrete part of a building is intended to be used

FIELD.LABEL: space typical state
FIELD.NAME: space typical state
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: customary or normal state of the space

FIELD.LABEL: typical occupant density
FIELD.NAME: typical occupant density
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: customary or normal density of occupants

FIELD.LABEL: occupancy at sampling
FIELD.NAME: occupancy at sampling
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: number of occupants present at time of sample within the given space

FIELD.LABEL: occupant density at sampling
FIELD.NAME: occupant density at sampling
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: average number of occupants at time of sampling per square footage

FIELD.LABEL: ventilation type
FIELD.NAME: ventilation type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The intentional movement of air from outside a building to the inside through forced or natural movement of air

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: source material identifiers
FIELD.NAME: source material identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).

FIELD.LABEL: sample material processing
FIELD.NAME: sample material processing
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A brief description of any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment, or a link to the relevant protocol(s) performed.

FIELD.LABEL: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.NAME: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material. Mandatory for MIGS and MIMARKS Specimen.

FIELD.LABEL: propagation
FIELD.NAME: propagation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of reproduction from the parent stock. Values for this field is specific to different taxa. For phage or virus: lytic/lysogenic/temperate/obligately lytic. For plasmids: incompatibility group. For eukaryotes: sexual/asexual. Mandatory for MIGs of eukayotes, plasmids and viruses.

FIELD.LABEL: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.NAME: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected.

FIELD.LABEL: sample size sorting method
FIELD.NAME: sample size sorting method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: method by which samples are sorted

FIELD.LABEL: organism count
FIELD.NAME: organism count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr)

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection device
FIELD.NAME: sample collection device
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The device used to collect an environmental sample. It is recommended to use terms listed under environmental sampling device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO) and/or terms listed under specimen collection device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0002094).

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection method
FIELD.NAME: sample collection method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method employed for collecting the sample. Can be provided in the form of a PMID, DOI, url or text.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host disorder

FIELD.LABEL: host disease status
FIELD.SYNONYM: health or disease status of specific host
FIELD.NAME: host disease status
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: list of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from DO (Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, other hosts are free text

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host description

FIELD.LABEL: host scientific name
FIELD.NAME: host scientific name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Scientific name of the natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which sample was obtained.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions

FIELD.LABEL: relative air humidity
FIELD.NAME: relative air humidity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: partial vapor and air pressure, density of the vapor and air, or by the actual mass of the vapor and air

FIELD.LABEL: absolute air humidity
FIELD.NAME: absolute air humidity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: actual mass of water vapor - mh20 - present in the air water vapor mixture

FIELD.LABEL: surface humidity
FIELD.NAME: surface humidity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: surface water activity as a function of air and material moisture

FIELD.LABEL: air temperature
FIELD.NAME: air temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature of the air at time of sampling

FIELD.LABEL: surface temperature
FIELD.NAME: surface temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature of the surface at time of sampling

FIELD.LABEL: surface moisture
FIELD.NAME: surface moisture
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: water held on the surface

FIELD.LABEL: surface moisture pH
FIELD.NAME: surface moisture pH
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: pH measurement of surface

FIELD.LABEL: dew point
FIELD.NAME: dew point
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The temperature to which a given parcel of humid air must be cooled, at constant barometric pressure, for water vapor to condense into water

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: concentration measurement

FIELD.LABEL: carbon dioxide
FIELD.NAME: carbon dioxide
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: carbon dioxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: organism characteristics

FIELD.LABEL: subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.NAME: subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Information about the genetic distinctness of the sequenced organism below the subspecies level, e.g., serovar, serotype, biotype, ecotype, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. Subspecies should not be recorded in this term, but in the NCBI taxonomy. Supply both the lineage name and the lineage rank separated by a colon, e.g., biovar:abc123.

FIELD.LABEL: trophic level
FIELD.NAME: trophic level
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Trophic levels are the feeding position in a food chain. Microbes can be a range of producers (e.g. chemolithotroph)

FIELD.LABEL: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.NAME: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments

FIELD.LABEL: known pathogenicity
FIELD.NAME: known pathogenicity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: To what is the entity pathogenic, for instance plant, fungi, bacteria

FIELD.LABEL: encoded traits
FIELD.NAME: encoded traits
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Should include key traits like antibiotic resistance or xenobiotic degradation phenotypes for plasmids, converting genes for phage

FIELD.LABEL: observed biotic relationship
FIELD.NAME: observed biotic relationship
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is it free-living or in a host and if the latter what type of relationship is observed

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions imposed

FIELD.LABEL: perturbation
FIELD.NAME: perturbation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: ENA Influenza virus reporting standard checklist
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: ENA Influenza virus reporting standard checklist
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: Minimum information about an Influenza virus sample. A checklist for reporting metadata of Influenza virus samples associated with genomic data. This minimum metadata standard supports submission of avian, human and mammalian surveillance data as well as serology and viruse isolate information (where available). The ENA Influenza sample checklist is based on standards in use at the Influenza Research Database.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Host inoculation
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Details on experimental inoculation of animal species.

FIELD.LABEL: number of inoculated individuals
FIELD.NAME: number of inoculated individuals
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Number of host individuals inoculated for the experiment.

FIELD.LABEL: inoculation route
FIELD.NAME: inoculation route
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Brief description of the protocol inoculation route.

FIELD.LABEL: inoculation dose
FIELD.NAME: inoculation dose
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Dose used for the inoculoation experiment.

FIELD.LABEL: inoculation stock availability
FIELD.NAME: inoculation stock availability
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is the virus stock used for the inoculation available?

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Human surveillance data
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Information associated with a human influenza surveillance sample.

FIELD.LABEL: subject exposure
FIELD.NAME: subject exposure
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Exposure of the subject to infected human or animals, such as poultry, wild bird or swine. If multiple exposures are applicable, please state them separated by semicolon. Example: poultry; wild bird

FIELD.LABEL: subject exposure duration
FIELD.NAME: subject exposure duration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Duration of the exposure of the subject to an infected human or animal. If multiple exposures are applicable, please state their duration in the same order in which you reported the exposure in the field 'subject exposure'. Example: 1 day; 0.33 days

FIELD.LABEL: type exposure
FIELD.NAME: type exposure
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Setting within which the subject is exposed to animals, such as farm, slaughterhouse, food preparation. If multiple exposures are applicable, please state their type in the same order in which you reported the exposure in the field 'subject exposure'. Example: backyard flock; confined animal feeding operation

FIELD.LABEL: personal protective equipment
FIELD.NAME: personal protective equipment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Use of personal protective equipment, such as gloves, gowns, during any type of exposure. Example: mask

FIELD.LABEL: hospitalisation
FIELD.NAME: hospitalisation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Was the subject confined to a hospital as a result of virus infection or problems occurring secondary to virus infection?

FIELD.LABEL: antiviral treatment
FIELD.NAME: antiviral treatment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Antiviral treatment used for this subject, such as Zanamavir Oseltamivir, Amantadine. Example: Rimantadine

FIELD.LABEL: antiviral treatment initiation
FIELD.NAME: antiviral treatment initiation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Initiation of antiviral treatment after onset of clinical symptoms in days. Example: 2.5

FIELD.LABEL: antiviral treatment dosage
FIELD.NAME: antiviral treatment dosage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Dosage of the treatment taken by the subject. Example: 0.05 mg

FIELD.LABEL: antiviral treatment duration
FIELD.NAME: antiviral treatment duration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Duration of antiviral treatment after onset of clinical symptoms in days.Example: 5

FIELD.LABEL: influenza vaccination type
FIELD.NAME: influenza vaccination type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Influenza vaccinations that have been administered to the subject over the last year. Example: 2009 H1N1 Flumist

FIELD.LABEL: influenza vaccination date
FIELD.NAME: influenza vaccination date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Date that the influenza vaccination was administered to the subject over the past year. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Example: 2007-05-12

FIELD.LABEL: source of vaccination information
FIELD.NAME: source of vaccination information
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Designation of information related to vaccination history as self reported or documented.

FIELD.LABEL: vaccine lot number
FIELD.NAME: vaccine lot number
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Lot number of the vaccine.

FIELD.LABEL: vaccine manufacturer
FIELD.NAME: vaccine manufacturer
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Manufacturer of the vaccine.

FIELD.LABEL: vaccine dosage
FIELD.NAME: vaccine dosage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Dosage of the vaccine taken by the subject. Example: 0.05 mL

FIELD.LABEL: influenza-like illness at the time of sample collection
FIELD.NAME: influenza-like illness at the time of sample collection
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is the subject at the time of sample collection considered to have influenza like illness?

FIELD.LABEL: illness onset date
FIELD.NAME: illness onset date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Date the subject showed an onset of symptoms. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Example: 2011-10-20

FIELD.LABEL: illness duration
FIELD.NAME: illness duration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The number of days the illness lasted. Example: 4

FIELD.LABEL: illness symptoms
FIELD.NAME: illness symptoms
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The symptoms that have been reported in relation to the illness, such as cough, diarrhea, fever, headache, malaise, myalgia, nausea, runny_nose, shortness_of_breath, sore_throat. If multiple exposures are applicable, please state them separated by semicolon.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Collection event information

FIELD.LABEL: collection date
FIELD.NAME: collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The date of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: sample capture status
FIELD.NAME: sample capture status
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reason for the sample collection.

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: active surveillance in response to outbreak
active surveillance not initiated by an outbreak

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host disorder

FIELD.LABEL: host disease outcome
FIELD.NAME: host disease outcome
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Disease outcome in the host.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host description

FIELD.LABEL: host common name
FIELD.NAME: host common name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: common name of the host, e.g. human

FIELD.LABEL: host subject id
FIELD.NAME: host subject id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: a unique identifier by which each subject can be referred to, de-identified, e.g. #131

FIELD.LABEL: host age
FIELD.NAME: host age
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: age of host at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees

FIELD.LABEL: host health state
FIELD.NAME: host health state
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Health status of the host at the time of sample collection.

FIELD.LABEL: host sex
FIELD.NAME: host sex
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Gender or sex of the host.

FIELD.LABEL: host scientific name
FIELD.NAME: host scientific name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Scientific name of the natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which sample was obtained.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Pathogen testing
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: General information on influenza and other pathogens testing.

FIELD.LABEL: influenza test method
FIELD.NAME: influenza test method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Method by which the current assessment of a sample as flu positive/negative is made. If multiple test were performed, please state them separated by semicolon. Example: RT-PCR; antigen ELISA

FIELD.LABEL: influenza test result
FIELD.NAME: influenza test result
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Classification of a sample as flu positive or negative based on the test performed and reported. If multiple tests were performed, please state the results in the same order in which you reported the tests in the field 'influenza test method'. Format: P(ositive)/N(egative). Example: P; P

FIELD.LABEL: other pathogens tested
FIELD.NAME: other pathogens tested
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Classification of pathogenic organisms other than influenza virus tested in the current assessment of a sample. If multiple tests were performed, please state them separated by semicolon. If no other pathogens test was performed, please state 'none'. Example: Newcastle

FIELD.LABEL: other pathogens test result
FIELD.NAME: other pathogens test result
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Classification of a sample as positive or negative based on the test performed and reported. If tests for multiple pathogenic organisms were performed, please state the results in the same order in which you reported the tests in the field 'other pathogens tested'. Format: P(ositive)/N(egative)/not applicable. Example: N

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Virus isolate information
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Information specific to viral isolates.

FIELD.LABEL: influenza virus type
FIELD.NAME: influenza virus type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: One of the three influenza virus classification types.

FIELD.LABEL: virus identifier
FIELD.NAME: virus identifier
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Unique laboratory identifier assigned to the virus by the investigator. Strain name is not sufficient since it might not be unique due to various passsages of the same virus. Format: up to 50 alphanumeric characters

FIELD.LABEL: influenza strain unique number
FIELD.NAME: influenza strain unique number
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Unique number of the strain which is reported as a part of the influenza strain name, such as A/chicken/Fujian/411/2002(HxN1). Format: integer number, Example: 411

FIELD.LABEL: WHO/OIE/FAO clade (required for HPAI H5N1 viruses)
FIELD.NAME: WHO/OIE/FAO clade (required for HPAI H5N1 viruses)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: WHO/OIE/FAO clade should be included for highly pathogenic H5N1 viruses. Example: 2.2

FIELD.LABEL: lineage:swl (required for H1N1 viruses)
FIELD.NAME: lineage:swl (required for H1N1 viruses)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Does the H1N1 influenza virus originate from a swine-like outbreak (as opposed to a seasonal flu)?

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: General collection event information
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: General information on the collection event.

FIELD.LABEL: collector name
FIELD.NAME: collector name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the person who collected the specimen. Example: John Smith

FIELD.LABEL: collecting institution
FIELD.NAME: collecting institution
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the institution to which the person collecting the specimen belongs. Format: Institute Name, Institute Address

FIELD.LABEL: receipt date
FIELD.NAME: receipt date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Date on which the sample was received. Format:YYYY-MM-DD. Please provide the highest precision possible. If the sample was received by the institution and not collected, the 'receipt date' must be provided instead. Either the 'collection date' or 'receipt date' must be provided. If available, provide both dates.

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage conditions
FIELD.NAME: sample storage conditions
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Conditions at which sample was stored, usually storage temperature, duration and location

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Serology detection
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Serology information complementing surveillance data.

FIELD.LABEL: definition for seropositive sample
FIELD.NAME: definition for seropositive sample
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The cut off value used by an investigatior in determining that a sample was seropositive.

FIELD.LABEL: meaning of cut off value
FIELD.NAME: meaning of cut off value
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description helping to explain what the cut off value means.

FIELD.LABEL: serotype (required for a seropositive sample)
FIELD.NAME: serotype (required for a seropositive sample)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Serological variety of a species characterised by its antigenic properties. For Influenza, HA subtype should be the letter H followed by a number between 1-16 unless novel subtype is identified and the NA subtype should be the letter N followed by a number between 1-9 unless novel subtype is identified. If only one of the subtypes have been tested then use the format H5Nx or HxN1. Example: H1N1

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Infraspecies information
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Formal and informal infraspecies taxonomic information

FIELD.LABEL: strain
FIELD.NAME: strain
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the strain from which the sample was obtained.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Associated host information
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Information regarding the data which is host associated

FIELD.LABEL: host habitat
FIELD.NAME: host habitat
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Natural habitat of the avian or mammalian host.

FIELD.LABEL: isolation source host-associated
FIELD.NAME: isolation source host-associated
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of host tissue or organ sampled for analysis. Example: tracheal tissue

FIELD.LABEL: host description
FIELD.NAME: host description
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Other descriptive information relating to the host.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host details

FIELD.LABEL: gravidity
FIELD.NAME: gravidity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Whether or not the subject is gravid. If so, report date due or date post-conception and specify which of these two dates is being reported.

FIELD.LABEL: host behaviour
FIELD.NAME: host behaviour
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Natural behaviour of the host.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Environmental information
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Environmental information if not host associated.

FIELD.LABEL: isolation source non-host-associated
FIELD.NAME: isolation source non-host-associated
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived. Example: soil

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: Plant Sample Checklist
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: ENA Plant Sample Checklist
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: ENA implementation of plant specimen contextual information associated with molecular data. The checklist has been developed in collaboration with the NCBI-GenBank and iPlant data resources under the umbrella of the Genomic Standards Consortium.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: non-sample terms

FIELD.LABEL: ploidy
FIELD.NAME: ploidy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly). For terms, please select terms listed under class ploidy (PATO:001374) of Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), and for a browser of PATO (v 2018-03-27) please refer to http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

FIELD.LABEL: number of replicons
FIELD.NAME: number of replicons
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes, bacteria, archaea and segmented virus.

FIELD.LABEL: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.NAME: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Do plasmids exist of significant phenotypic consequence (e.g. ones that determine virulence or antibiotic resistance). Megaplasmids? Other plasmids (borrelia has 15+ plasmids).

FIELD.LABEL: estimated size
FIELD.NAME: estimated size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The estimated size of the genome (in bp) prior to sequencing. Of particular importance in the sequencing of (eukaryotic) genome which could remain in draft form for a long or unspecified period. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes.

FIELD.LABEL: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.NAME: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Volume (ml) or mass (g) of total collected sample processed for DNA extraction. Note: total sample collected should be entered under the term 'sample size'.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Collection event information

FIELD.LABEL: collected_by
FIELD.NAME: collected_by
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: name of persons or institute who collected the specimen

FIELD.LABEL: collection date
FIELD.NAME: collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The date of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

FIELD.LABEL: altitude
FIELD.NAME: altitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

FIELD.LABEL: identified_by
FIELD.NAME: identified_by
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: name of the expert who identified the specimen taxonomically

FIELD.LABEL: depth
FIELD.NAME: depth
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The vertical distance below local surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.

FIELD.LABEL: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.NAME: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: local environmental context
FIELD.NAME: local environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for "broad-scale environmental context". Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: elevation
FIELD.NAME: elevation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: source material identifiers
FIELD.NAME: source material identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection device or method
FIELD.NAME: sample collection device or method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method or deviced employed for collecting the sample

FIELD.LABEL: sample material processing
FIELD.NAME: sample material processing
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A brief description of any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment, or a link to the relevant protocol(s) performed.

FIELD.LABEL: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.NAME: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material. Mandatory for MIGS and MIMARKS Specimen.

FIELD.LABEL: propagation
FIELD.NAME: propagation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of reproduction from the parent stock. Values for this field is specific to different taxa. For phage or virus: lytic/lysogenic/temperate/obligately lytic. For plasmids: incompatibility group. For eukaryotes: sexual/asexual. Mandatory for MIGs of eukayotes, plasmids and viruses.

FIELD.LABEL: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.NAME: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected.

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage duration
FIELD.NAME: sample storage duration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: duration for which sample was stored

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage temperature
FIELD.NAME: sample storage temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage location
FIELD.NAME: sample storage location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

FIELD.LABEL: plant structure
FIELD.NAME: plant structure
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: name of plant structure that the sample was obtained from; for Plant Ontology (PO) terms see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PO, e.g. petiole epidermis (PO_0000051); if an individual flower is sampled the sex of it can be recorded here

FIELD.LABEL: plant developmental stage
FIELD.NAME: plant developmental stage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: developmental stage at the time of sample collection; for Plant Ontology (PO) (v 20) terms, see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PO, e.g. hypocotyl emergence stage (PO_0007043)

FIELD.LABEL: sampled age
FIELD.NAME: sampled age
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: age of subject at the time of sample collection; relevant scale depends on species and study; e.g. 2 weeks old

FIELD.LABEL: sample phenotype
FIELD.NAME: sample phenotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: phenotype of the plant from which the sample was obtained, such as colour of corolla, fruit diameter, circular leaf shape; Plant Trait Ontology (TO), Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), or other ontology is recommended; e.g. stem epidermis colour (TO:1000018)

FIELD.LABEL: sample health state
FIELD.NAME: sample health state
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: health status of the subject at the time of sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: sample disease status
FIELD.NAME: sample disease status
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: list of diseases with which the subject has been diagnosed at the time of sample collection; can include multiple diagnoses; the value of the field depends on subject; e.g. Charcoal rot (Macrophomina phaseolina), Late wilt (Cephalosporium maydis)

FIELD.LABEL: sample disease stage
FIELD.NAME: sample disease stage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: stage of the disease at the time of sample collection, e.g. inoculation, penetration, infection, growth and reproduction, dissemination of pathogen

FIELD.LABEL: sample wet mass
FIELD.NAME: sample wet mass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of wet mass at the time of sample collection; e.g. 0.23 g

FIELD.LABEL: sample dry mass
FIELD.NAME: sample dry mass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of dry mass at the time of sample collection; e.g. 0.05g

FIELD.LABEL: sample height
FIELD.NAME: sample height
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: height of subject at the time of sampling, if different from the length; e.g. 0.75m

FIELD.LABEL: sample length
FIELD.NAME: sample length
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: length of subject at the time of sampling, if different from the height; e.g. 2m

FIELD.LABEL: growth facility
FIELD.NAME: growth facility
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: type of facility where the sampled plant was grown

FIELD.LABEL: sample capture status
FIELD.NAME: sample capture status
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reason for the sample collection.

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: active surveillance in response to outbreak
active surveillance not initiated by an outbreak

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Organism characteristics
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Characteristics of the source organism

FIELD.LABEL: genotype
FIELD.NAME: genotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: name or code for genotype of organism

FIELD.LABEL: genetic modification
FIELD.NAME: genetic modification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A genetic modification of the genome of an organism which may occur naturally by spontaneous mutation, or be introduced by some experimental means. Examples of genetic modification include specification of a transgene or the gene knocked-out or details of transient transfection.

FIELD.LABEL: organism common name
FIELD.NAME: organism common name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: common name of the subject organism, e.g. maize

FIELD.LABEL: subspecific genetic lineage rank
FIELD.NAME: subspecific genetic lineage rank
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: further information about the genetic distinctness of this lineage by recording additional information i.e. variety, cultivar, ecotype, inbred line,; it can also contain alternative taxonomic information

FIELD.LABEL: subspecific genetic lineage name
FIELD.NAME: subspecific genetic lineage name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: name of the infraspecific rank, e.g ecotype Col-0

FIELD.LABEL: biological status
FIELD.NAME: biological status
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the level of genome modification; controlled vocabulary: wild, natural, semi-natural, inbred line, breeder's line, hybrid, clonal selection, mutant

FIELD.LABEL: organism phenotype
FIELD.NAME: organism phenotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: most relevant phenotypic traits of the subject; for Phenotypic quality Ontology (PATO) (v 2013-10-28) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO, e.g. bifurcated (PATO_0001784); terms from Trait Ontology (TO), Plant Ontology (PO) or Crop Ontology (CO) are also accepted; include name/method/scale for each trait; can include multiple traits

FIELD.LABEL: ancestral data
FIELD.NAME: ancestral data
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about either pedigree or other description of ancestral information (e.g. parental variety in case of mutant or selection), e.g. A/3*B (meaning [(A x B) x B] x B)

FIELD.LABEL: source material description
FIELD.NAME: source material description
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: further information to clarify the nature of the specimen or population used that is not collected elsewhere, e.g. if source was derived from accessioned stock, describe how it links to the original material

FIELD.LABEL: biotic relationship
FIELD.NAME: biotic relationship
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: free text description of relationship(s) between the subject organism and other organism(s) it is associate with, e.g., parasite on species X; mutualist with species Y, the target organism is the subject of the relationship, and the other organism(s) is the object

FIELD.LABEL: growth habit
FIELD.NAME: growth habit
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: characteristic shape, appearance or growth form of a plant species

FIELD.LABEL: plant sex
FIELD.NAME: plant sex
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: sex of the reproductive parts on the whole plant, e.g. pistilate, staminate, monoecieous, hermaphrodite

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions

FIELD.LABEL: climate environment
FIELD.NAME: climate environment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: treatment involving an exposure to a particular climate; can include multiple climates

FIELD.LABEL: gaseous environment
FIELD.NAME: gaseous environment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: use of conditions with differing gaseous environments; should include the name of gaseous compound, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple gaseous environment regimens

FIELD.LABEL: seasonal environment
FIELD.NAME: seasonal environment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: treatment involving an exposure to a particular season (e.g. winter, summer, rabi, rainy etc.)

FIELD.LABEL: soil_taxonomic/FAO classification
FIELD.NAME: soil_taxonomic/FAO classification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: soil classification from the FAO World Reference Database for Soil Resources

FIELD.LABEL: soil_taxonomic/local classification
FIELD.NAME: soil_taxonomic/local classification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: soil classification based on local soil classification system

FIELD.LABEL: soil_taxonomic/local classification method
FIELD.NAME: soil_taxonomic/local classification method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining the local soil classification

FIELD.LABEL: soil type
FIELD.NAME: soil type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of the soil type or classification. This field accepts terms under soil (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00001998). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: soil type method
FIELD.NAME: soil type method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining soil series name or other lower-level classification

FIELD.LABEL: drainage classification
FIELD.NAME: drainage classification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: drainage classification from a standard system such as the USDA system

FIELD.LABEL: soil texture measurement
FIELD.NAME: soil texture measurement
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the relative proportion of different grain sizes of mineral particles in a soil, as described using a standard system; express as % sand (50 um to 2 mm), silt (2 um to 50 um), and clay (<2 um) with textural name (e.g., silty clay loam) optional.

FIELD.LABEL: soil texture method
FIELD.NAME: soil texture method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining soil texture

FIELD.LABEL: soil water content
FIELD.NAME: soil water content
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: water content measurement; e.g. 13.6%

FIELD.LABEL: soil pH
FIELD.NAME: soil pH
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: pH measurement of the soil; e.g. 6.2

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: growth medium
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: specification of the substance where a plant sample has been grown

FIELD.LABEL: plant growth medium
FIELD.NAME: plant growth medium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specification of the media for growing the plants or tissue cultured samples, e.g. soil, aeroponic, hydroponic, in vitro solid culture medium, in vitro liquid culture medium. Recommended value is a specific value from EO:plant growth medium (follow this link for terms http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/EO_0007147).

FIELD.LABEL: rooting conditions
FIELD.NAME: rooting conditions
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: relevant rooting conditions, such as field plot size, sowing density, container dimensions, number of plants per container

FIELD.LABEL: culture rooting medium
FIELD.NAME: culture rooting medium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: name or reference for the hydroponic or in vitro culture rooting medium, can be a name of a commonly used medium or reference to a specific medium; e.g. Murashige and Skoog medium, if the medium has not been formally published, use the rooting medium descriptors

FIELD.LABEL: rooting medium macronutrients
FIELD.NAME: rooting medium macronutrients
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of the culture rooting medium macronutrients (N,P, K, Ca, Mg, S); e.g. KH2PO4 (170mg/L)

FIELD.LABEL: rooting medium micronutrients
FIELD.NAME: rooting medium micronutrients
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of the culture rooting medium micronutrients (Fe, Mn, Zn, B, Cu, Mo); e.g. H3BO3 (6.2mg/L)

FIELD.LABEL: rooting medium organic supplements
FIELD.NAME: rooting medium organic supplements
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: organic supplements of the culture rooting medium, such as vitaimins, amino acids, organic acids, antibiotics activated charcoal; e.g. Nicotinic acid (0.5mg/L)

FIELD.LABEL: rooting medium carbon
FIELD.NAME: rooting medium carbon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: source of organic carbon in the culture rooting medium; e.g. sucrose

FIELD.LABEL: rooting medium regulators
FIELD.NAME: rooting medium regulators
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: growth regulators in the culture rooting medium, such as cytokinins, auxins, gybberellins, abscisic acid; e.g. 0.5mg/L NAA

FIELD.LABEL: rooting medium solidifier
FIELD.NAME: rooting medium solidifier
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: specification of the solidifying agent in the culture rooting medium; e.g. agar

FIELD.LABEL: rooting medium pH
FIELD.NAME: rooting medium pH
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: pH measurement of the culture rooting medium; e.g. 5.5

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions imposed

FIELD.LABEL: air temperature regimen
FIELD.NAME: air temperature regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving an exposure to varying temperatures; should include the temperature, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include different temperature regimens

FIELD.LABEL: antibiotic regimen
FIELD.NAME: antibiotic regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving antibiotic administration; should include the name of antibiotic, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple antibiotic regimens

FIELD.LABEL: chemical mutagen
FIELD.NAME: chemical mutagen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: treatment involving use of mutagens; should include the name of mutagen, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple mutagen regimens

FIELD.LABEL: fertilizer regimen
FIELD.NAME: fertilizer regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving the use of fertilizers; should include the name fertilizer, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple fertilizer regimens

FIELD.LABEL: fungicide regimen
FIELD.NAME: fungicide regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving use of fungicides; should include the name of fungicide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple fungicide regimens

FIELD.LABEL: gravity
FIELD.NAME: gravity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving use of gravity factor to study various types of responses in presence, absence or modified levels of gravity; can include multiple treatments

FIELD.LABEL: growth hormone regimen
FIELD.NAME: growth hormone regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of growth hormone, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple growth hormone regimens

FIELD.LABEL: herbicide regimen
FIELD.NAME: herbicide regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving use of herbicides; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of herbicide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple regimens

FIELD.LABEL: humidity regimen
FIELD.NAME: humidity regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving an exposure to varying degree of humidity; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include amount of humidity administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple regimens

FIELD.LABEL: mineral nutrient regimen
FIELD.NAME: mineral nutrient regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving the use of mineral supplements; should include the name of mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple mineral nutrient regimens

FIELD.LABEL: non-mineral nutrient regimen
FIELD.NAME: non-mineral nutrient regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving the exposure of plant to non-mineral nutrient such as oxygen, hydrogen or carbon; should include the name of non-mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple non-mineral nutrient regimens

FIELD.LABEL: pesticide regimen
FIELD.NAME: pesticide regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving use of insecticides; should include the name of pesticide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple pesticide regimens

FIELD.LABEL: pH regimen
FIELD.NAME: pH regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving exposure of plants to varying levels of pH of the growth media; can include multiple regimen

FIELD.LABEL: radiation regimen
FIELD.NAME: radiation regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving exposure of plant or a plant part to a particular radiation regimen; should include the radiation type, amount or intensity administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple radiation regimens

FIELD.LABEL: rainfall regimen
FIELD.NAME: rainfall regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving an exposure to a given amount of rainfall; can include multiple regimens

FIELD.LABEL: salt regimen
FIELD.NAME: salt regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving use of salts as supplement to liquid and soil growth media; should include the name of salt, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple salt regimens

FIELD.LABEL: standing water regimen
FIELD.NAME: standing water regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: treatment involving an exposure to standing water during a plant's life span, types can be flood water or standing water; can include multiple regimens

FIELD.LABEL: watering regimen
FIELD.NAME: watering regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving an exposure to watering frequencies; can include multiple regimens

FIELD.LABEL: water temperature regimen
FIELD.NAME: water temperature regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving an exposure to water with varying degree of temperature; can include multiple regimens

FIELD.LABEL: plant treatment
FIELD.NAME: plant treatment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: ontology term(s) that describes the plant treatment or relevant environmental conditions, recommend use of Plant Environment Ontology (EO) or other ontology, such as XEML Environment Ontology (XEO) or Crop Ontology (CO), more specific fields in the treatment section can be used in addition to or in place of this field

FIELD.LABEL: light regimen
FIELD.NAME: light regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving an exposure to light, this includes both light intensity and quality

FIELD.LABEL: biotic regimen
FIELD.NAME: biotic regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving use of biotic factors, such as bacteria, viruses or fungi

FIELD.LABEL: mechanical damage
FIELD.NAME: mechanical damage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about any mechanical damage exerted on the plant; can include multiple damages and sites

FIELD.LABEL: chemical administration
FIELD.NAME: chemical administration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v111), please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/CHEBI

FIELD.LABEL: perturbation
FIELD.NAME: perturbation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: ENA binned metagenome
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: ENA binned metagenome
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: Minimum information to standardise metadata of binned metagenome samples. Ensures binned and MAG metagenome assembly metadata is compatible.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: non-sample terms

FIELD.LABEL: project name
FIELD.NAME: project name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized

FIELD.LABEL: experimental factor
FIELD.NAME: experimental factor
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Experimental factors are essentially the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI). For a browser of EFO (v 2.95) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/EFO; for a browser of OBI (v 2018-02-12) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI. E.g. time series design [EFO:EFO_0001779]

FIELD.LABEL: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.NAME: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Primary publication if isolated before genome publication; otherwise, primary genome report. Mandatory for MIGS of bacteria and archaea.

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the material separation to recover the nucleic acid fraction from a sample

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the enzymatic amplification (PCR, TMA, NASBA) of specific nucleic acids

FIELD.LABEL: library size
FIELD.NAME: library size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project

FIELD.LABEL: library reads sequenced
FIELD.NAME: library reads sequenced
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones sequenced from the library

FIELD.LABEL: library vector
FIELD.NAME: library vector
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Cloning vector type(s) used in construction of libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library screening strategy
FIELD.NAME: library screening strategy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating clone libraries in order to select a specific group of sequences

FIELD.LABEL: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.NAME: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Molecular barcodes, called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: adapters
FIELD.NAME: adapters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: sequencing method
FIELD.NAME: sequencing method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequencing machine used. Where possible the term should be taken from the OBI list of DNA sequencers (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0400103).

FIELD.LABEL: relevant electronic resources
FIELD.NAME: relevant electronic resources
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise associated to the sequence in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

FIELD.LABEL: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.NAME: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Standard operating procedures used in assembly and/or annotation of genomes, metagenomes or environmental sequences in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

FIELD.LABEL: number of standard tRNAs extracted
FIELD.NAME: number of standard tRNAs extracted
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total number of tRNAs identified from the bin, SAG or MAG

FIELD.LABEL: assembly software
FIELD.NAME: assembly software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool(s) used for assembly, including version number and parameters in the format {software};{version};{parameters} e.g. metaSPAdes;3.11.0;kmer set 21,33,55,77,99,121, default parameters otherwise

FIELD.LABEL: 16S recovered
FIELD.NAME: 16S recovered
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Can a 16S gene be recovered from the submitted bin, SAG or MAG?

FIELD.LABEL: 16S recovery software
FIELD.NAME: 16S recovery software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tools used for 16S rRNA gene extraction. Add names and versions of software(s), parameters used

FIELD.LABEL: tRNA extraction software
FIELD.NAME: tRNA extraction software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tools used for tRNA identification. Add names and versions of software(s), parameters used

FIELD.LABEL: completeness score
FIELD.NAME: completeness score
