FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the enzymatic amplification (PCR, TMA, NASBA) of specific nucleic acids

FIELD.LABEL: library size
FIELD.NAME: library size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project

FIELD.LABEL: library reads sequenced
FIELD.NAME: library reads sequenced
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones sequenced from the library

FIELD.LABEL: library vector
FIELD.NAME: library vector
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Cloning vector type(s) used in construction of libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library screening strategy
FIELD.NAME: library screening strategy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating clone libraries in order to select a specific group of sequences

FIELD.LABEL: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.NAME: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Molecular barcodes, called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: adapters
FIELD.NAME: adapters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: sequencing method
FIELD.NAME: sequencing method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequencing machine used. Where possible the term should be taken from the OBI list of DNA sequencers (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0400103).

FIELD.LABEL: relevant electronic resources
FIELD.NAME: relevant electronic resources
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise associated to the sequence in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

FIELD.LABEL: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.NAME: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Standard operating procedures used in assembly and/or annotation of genomes, metagenomes or environmental sequences in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

FIELD.LABEL: number of standard tRNAs extracted
FIELD.NAME: number of standard tRNAs extracted
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total number of tRNAs identified from the bin, SAG or MAG

FIELD.LABEL: assembly software
FIELD.NAME: assembly software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool(s) used for assembly, including version number and parameters in the format {software};{version};{parameters} e.g. metaSPAdes;3.11.0;kmer set 21,33,55,77,99,121, default parameters otherwise

FIELD.LABEL: feature prediction
FIELD.NAME: feature prediction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Method used to predict UViGs features such as ORFs, integration site, etc. Add names and versions of software(s), parameters used

FIELD.LABEL: reference database(s)
FIELD.NAME: reference database(s)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: List of database(s) used for ORF annotation, along with version number and reference to website or publication

FIELD.LABEL: similarity search method
FIELD.NAME: similarity search method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool used to compare ORFs with database, along with version and cutoffs used. Add names and versions of software(s), parameters used

FIELD.LABEL: tRNA extraction software
FIELD.NAME: tRNA extraction software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tools used for tRNA identification. Add names and versions of software(s), parameters used

FIELD.LABEL: completeness score
FIELD.NAME: completeness score
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Completeness score is typically based on either the fraction of markers found as compared to a database or the percent of a genome found as compared to a closely related reference genome. Completeness score is one of 3 attributes which in combination reflect the standard quality of a MAG, see here for more information: https://ena-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/faq_metagenomes.html.

FIELD.LABEL: completeness software
FIELD.NAME: completeness software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tools used for completion estimate, i.e. checkm, anvi'o, busco

FIELD.LABEL: completeness approach
FIELD.NAME: completeness approach
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The approach used to determine the completeness of a given bin, SAG or MAG, which would typically make use of a set of conserved marker genes or a closely related reference genome. For UViG completeness, include reference genome or group used, and contig feature suggesting a complete genome

FIELD.LABEL: binning software
FIELD.NAME: binning software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool(s) used for the extraction of genomes from metagenomic datasets, where possible include a product ID (PID) of the tool(s) used. E.g. MetaCluster-TA (RRID:SCR_004599) or MaxBin (biotools:maxbin)

FIELD.LABEL: reassembly post binning
FIELD.NAME: reassembly post binning
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Has an assembly been performed on a genome bin extracted from a metagenomic assembly?

FIELD.LABEL: MAG coverage software
FIELD.NAME: MAG coverage software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool(s) used to determine the genome coverage if coverage is used as a binning parameter in the extraction of genomes from metagenomic datasets e.g. bwa, bbmap, bowtie, other

FIELD.LABEL: binning parameters
FIELD.NAME: binning parameters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The parameters that have been applied during the extraction of genomes from metagenomic datasets e.g. coverage and kmer

FIELD.LABEL: taxonomic identity marker
FIELD.NAME: taxonomic identity marker
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The phylogenetic marker(s) used to assign an organism name to the bin, SAG or MAG. Examples are 16S gene, multi-marker approach or other e.g. rpoB gene

FIELD.LABEL: taxonomic classification
FIELD.NAME: taxonomic classification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Method used for taxonomic classification, along with reference database used, classification rank, and thresholds used to classify new genomes. Expected values are: classification method, database name, and other parameters e.g. vConTACT vContact2 (references from NCBI RefSeq v83, genus rank classification, default parameters)

FIELD.LABEL: sorting technology
FIELD.NAME: sorting technology
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Method used to sort/isolate cells or particles of interest

FIELD.LABEL: single cell or viral particle lysis approach
FIELD.NAME: single cell or viral particle lysis approach
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Method used to free DNA from interior of the cell(s) or particle(s)

FIELD.LABEL: single cell or viral particle lysis kit protocol
FIELD.NAME: single cell or viral particle lysis kit protocol
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the kit or standard protocol used for cell(s) or particle(s) lysis

FIELD.LABEL: WGA amplification approach
FIELD.NAME: WGA amplification approach
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Method used to amplify genomic DNA in preparation for sequencing

FIELD.LABEL: WGA amplification kit
FIELD.NAME: WGA amplification kit
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Kit used to amplify genomic DNA in preparation for sequencing

FIELD.LABEL: source of UViGs
FIELD.NAME: source of UViGs
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Type of dataset from which the UViG was obtained

FIELD.LABEL: virus enrichment approach
FIELD.NAME: virus enrichment approach
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: List of approaches used to enrich the sample for viruses, if any

FIELD.LABEL: predicted genome type
FIELD.NAME: predicted genome type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Type of genome predicted for the UViG

FIELD.LABEL: predicted genome structure
FIELD.NAME: predicted genome structure
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Expected structure of the viral genome

FIELD.LABEL: detection type
FIELD.NAME: detection type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Type of UViG detection

FIELD.LABEL: viral identification software
FIELD.NAME: viral identification software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool(s) used for the identification of UViG as a viral genome, software or protocol name including version number, parameters, and cutoffs used formatted {software};{version};{parameters} e.g. VirSorter; 1.0.4; Virome database, category 2

FIELD.LABEL: OTU classification approach
FIELD.NAME: OTU classification approach
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Cutoffs and approach used when clustering “species-level” OTUs. Note that results from standard 95% ANI / 85% AF clustering should be provided alongside OTUS defined from another set of thresholds, even if the latter are the ones primarily used during the analysis. This should be formatted {ANI cutoff};{AF cutoff};{clustering method} e.g. 95% ANI;85% AF; greedy incremental clustering

FIELD.LABEL: OTU sequence comparison approach
FIELD.NAME: OTU sequence comparison approach
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool and thresholds used to compare sequences when computing "species-level" OTUs formatted: {software};{version};{parameters} e.g. gblastn;2.6.0+;e-value cutoff: 0.001

FIELD.LABEL: OTU database
FIELD.NAME: OTU database
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference database (i.e. sequences not generated as part of the current study) used to cluster new genomes in "species-level" OTUs, if any. This should be formatted: {database};{version} e.g. NCBI Viral RefSeq;83

FIELD.LABEL: host prediction approach
FIELD.NAME: host prediction approach
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool or approach used for host prediction

FIELD.LABEL: host prediction estimated accuracy
FIELD.NAME: host prediction estimated accuracy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For each tool or approach used for host prediction, estimated false discovery rates should be included, either computed de novo or from the literature

FIELD.LABEL: UViG assembly quality
FIELD.NAME: UViG assembly quality
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: UViG assembly quality is one of 3 attributes which in combination reflect the standard quality of a UViG, see here for more information: https://ena-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/faq_metagenomes.html.

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: One or multiple fragments, totaling ≥ 90% of the expected genome or replicon sequence or predicted complete
One or multiple fragments, totalling < 90% of the expected genome or replicon sequence, or for which no genome size could be estimated
Single, validated, contiguous sequence per replicon without gaps or ambiguities, with extensive manual review and editing to annotate putative gene functions and transcriptional units

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Collection event information

FIELD.LABEL: isolation_source
FIELD.NAME: isolation_source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived

FIELD.LABEL: collection date
FIELD.NAME: collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The date of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

FIELD.LABEL: altitude
FIELD.NAME: altitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

FIELD.LABEL: depth
FIELD.NAME: depth
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The vertical distance below local surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.

FIELD.LABEL: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.NAME: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: local environmental context
FIELD.NAME: local environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for "broad-scale environmental context". Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: environmental medium
FIELD.NAME: environmental medium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).

FIELD.LABEL: elevation
FIELD.NAME: elevation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: source material identifiers
FIELD.NAME: source material identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).

FIELD.LABEL: sample material processing
FIELD.NAME: sample material processing
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A brief description of any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment, or a link to the relevant protocol(s) performed.

FIELD.LABEL: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.NAME: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected.

FIELD.LABEL: size fraction selected
FIELD.NAME: size fraction selected
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Filtering pore size used in sample preparation e.g. 0-0.22 micrometer

FIELD.LABEL: sample derived from
FIELD.NAME: sample derived from
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to parental sample(s) or original run(s) that the assembly is derived from. The referenced samples or runs should already be registered in INSDC. This should be formatted as one of the following. A single sample/run e.g. ERSxxxxxx OR a comma separated list e.g. ERSxxxxxx,ERSxxxxxx OR a range e.g. ERSxxxxxx-ERSxxxxxx

FIELD.LABEL: metagenomic source
FIELD.NAME: metagenomic source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The metagenomic source of the sample. This value should contain “metagenome” and be in the taxonomy database e.g. wastewater metagenome or human gut metagenome. Please note “metagenome” alone will not be accepted. Check here for more details on metagenome taxonomy: https://ena-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/faq_taxonomy.html#environmental-taxonomic-classifications

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection device
FIELD.NAME: sample collection device
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The device used to collect an environmental sample. It is recommended to use terms listed under environmental sampling device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO) and/or terms listed under specimen collection device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0002094).

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection method
FIELD.NAME: sample collection method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method employed for collecting the sample. Can be provided in the form of a PMID, DOI, url or text.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host description

FIELD.LABEL: host scientific name
FIELD.NAME: host scientific name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Scientific name of the natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which sample was obtained.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: organism characteristics

FIELD.LABEL: known pathogenicity
FIELD.NAME: known pathogenicity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: To what is the entity pathogenic, for instance plant, fungi, bacteria

FIELD.LABEL: observed biotic relationship
FIELD.NAME: observed biotic relationship
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is it free-living or in a host and if the latter what type of relationship is observed

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: PDX Checklist
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: PDX Checklist
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: Minimum information required for reporting samples associated with patient-derived xenograft (PDX) models or patient samples

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: sample origin
FIELD.NAME: sample origin
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sample origin from which data deposited was generated, e.g. Engrafted tumor

FIELD.LABEL: sample taxon name
FIELD.NAME: sample taxon name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This field indicates if a sample is derived from a patient or xenograft. The following two options are available: Homo sapiens/Mus musculus xenograft (sample is from a Xenograft derived tumor/cell culture) or Homo sapiens (sample is from a patient tumor/cell culture). Please ensure the selected value here is identical to the value in the 'scientific name' column/field.

FIELD.LABEL: sample material
FIELD.NAME: sample material
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sample material from which data deposited was generated, e.g. tissue fragment. If unknown please select "not provided".

FIELD.LABEL: engrafted tumor sample passage
FIELD.NAME: engrafted tumor sample passage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: If engrafted tumor sample, please indicate the passage from which the engrafted tumor sample was harvested (passage 0 must be the first engraftment in the mouse). Please ensure you add a non-negative number greater than 0. If the sample origin is “patient tumor” please enter "not applicable". If passage number is unknown please enter "not provided”.

FIELD.LABEL: engrafted tumor collection site
FIELD.NAME: engrafted tumor collection site
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: If the sample origin is “engrafted tumor”, please indicate the collection site from which the engrafted tumor sample was extracted (e.g. Liver). Please use terminology from NCIT ontology: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/ncit. If unknown please select NCIT term: “Not Available” ( http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C126101)”. If the sample origin is “patient tumor” please do not use this attribute.

FIELD.LABEL: patient tumor site of collection
FIELD.NAME: patient tumor site of collection
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Site of collection of the patient tissue sample which was extracted (can be different to primary site if it is a metastatic sample). Please use NCIT ontology, e.g. Liver (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C12392). If unknown please select NCIT term: “Not Available” (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C126101)

FIELD.LABEL: patient tumor type
FIELD.NAME: patient tumor type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For a primary sample (a tumor at the original site of origin), please select “Primary Neoplasm” . For a metastatic sample (a tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site), please select “Metastatic Neoplasm” . For a recurring neoplasm sample (neoplasm returning after a period of remission at the same location), please select “Recurrent Neoplasm” . If unknown tumor type, please select “not provided”.

FIELD.LABEL: sample unique ID
FIELD.NAME: sample unique ID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Unique identifier of the PDX or tumor sample, e.g. CRC00003

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Associated host information
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Information regarding the data which is host associated

FIELD.LABEL: engraftment host strain name
FIELD.NAME: engraftment host strain name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: If the sample origin is “engrafted tumor”, please indicate the host mouse strain name from which the engrafted tumor sample was extracted (e.g. NOD.Cg-Prkdcscid Il2rgtm1Wjl/SzJ). Please use the following guidelines for the correct nomenclature format: http://www.informatics.jax.org/mgihome/nomen/strains.shtml#mice. If the sample origin is “patient tumor” please add "not applicable" and if unknown please add "not provided".

FIELD.LABEL: patient age at collection of tumor
FIELD.NAME: patient age at collection of tumor
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Age in years of the patient when the tumor was extracted. Please note this must be a whole number, e.g. 45

FIELD.LABEL: patient tumor diagnosis at time of collection
FIELD.NAME: patient tumor diagnosis at time of collection
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Patient tumor diagnosis at time of collection for engraftment in PDX model or organoid/cell derivation. Please use terminology from NCIT ontology: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/ncit - Please note in NCIT ontology, usually the “cancer” concept is represented with “malignant neoplasm”example: “lung cancer” is “Malignant Lung Neoplasm” (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C7377). If precise diagnosis is unknown, please use "Neoplasm" (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C3262)

FIELD.LABEL: patient tumor primary site
FIELD.NAME: patient tumor primary site
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Site of the primary tumor where cancer originates (may not correspond to the site of the collected tissue sample). Please use NCIT ontology, e.g. Colon (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C12382). If unknown please select NCIT term: “Not Available” ( http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C126101)

FIELD.LABEL: Was the PDX model humanised?
FIELD.NAME: was the PDX model humanised?
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: If the sample origin is “engrafted tumor”, please indicate if the host strain, from which the sample was extracted, has undergone human immune system reconstitution, using “Yes” (model humanised) or “No” (model not humanised). If the sample origin is “patient tumor” please select "not applicable".

FIELD.LABEL: patient sex
FIELD.NAME: patient sex
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sex of the patient from which the tumor was extracted. If sex is unknown please select “not available”

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: ENA sewage checklist
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: ENA sewage checklist
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: Minimum information about sewage samples. A checklist for reporting of sewage surveillance samples associated with sequence data from metagenomic sequencing projects. This minimum metadata standard was developed by the COMPARE platform.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: geography

FIELD.LABEL: name of the sampling site
FIELD.NAME: name of the sampling site
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Refers to the name of the site/station where data/sample collection is performed.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: non-sample terms

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the material separation to recover the nucleic acid fraction from a sample

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the enzymatic amplification (PCR, TMA, NASBA) of specific nucleic acids

FIELD.LABEL: investigation type
FIELD.NAME: investigation type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Nucleic Acid Sequence Report is the root element of all MIxS compliant reports as standardised by Genomic Standards Consortium

FIELD.LABEL: surveillance target
FIELD.NAME: surveillance target
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Valid species level NCBI taxon id of the organism being surveyed for (if any) e.g. for Escherichia coli enter 562.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Collection event information

FIELD.LABEL: collection date
FIELD.NAME: collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The date of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.NAME: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected.

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage duration
FIELD.NAME: sample storage duration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: duration for which sample was stored

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage temperature
FIELD.NAME: sample storage temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage location
FIELD.NAME: sample storage location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

FIELD.LABEL: sample transportation temperature
FIELD.NAME: sample transportation temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: transportation temperature from sample site to storage

FIELD.LABEL: sample transportation date
FIELD.NAME: sample transportation date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: transportation/shipping date of the sample. Format:YYYY-MM-DD

FIELD.LABEL: sample transportation time
FIELD.NAME: sample transportation time
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: transportation time from sample site to storage

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: General collection event information
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: General information on the collection event.

FIELD.LABEL: receipt date
FIELD.NAME: receipt date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Date on which the sample was received. Format:YYYY-MM-DD. Please provide the highest precision possible. If the sample was received by the institution and not collected, the 'receipt date' must be provided instead. Either the 'collection date' or 'receipt date' must be provided. If available, provide both dates.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions

FIELD.LABEL: sewage type
FIELD.NAME: sewage type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Type of sewage based on origin: wastewater treatment plant (municipal or industrial), open sewer line, river, stream, stagnant pool, or other.

FIELD.LABEL: temperature
FIELD.NAME: temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature of the sample at time of sampling

FIELD.LABEL: area of sampling site
FIELD.NAME: area of sampling site
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Please indicate if there are specific facilities in the area covered by the sewage sample. For example: farming, slaughterhouse(s), industry, hospital(s) or any other facility.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: demography

FIELD.LABEL: size of the catchment area
FIELD.NAME: size of the catchment area
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Refers to the size of the area that is drained by the sampled sewage system in square km.

FIELD.LABEL: population size of the catchment area
FIELD.NAME: population size of the catchment area
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Refers to the number of people living in the area covered by the sewage system.

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: GSC MIMAGS
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: GSC MIMAGS
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: Genomic Standards Consortium package extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from the environment where the sample was obtained. By choosing the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from a relevant subsets of the GSC terms.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: non-sample terms

FIELD.LABEL: project name
FIELD.NAME: project name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized

FIELD.LABEL: experimental factor
FIELD.NAME: experimental factor
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Experimental factors are essentially the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI). For a browser of EFO (v 2.95) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/EFO; for a browser of OBI (v 2018-02-12) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI. E.g. time series design [EFO:EFO_0001779]

FIELD.LABEL: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.NAME: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Primary publication if isolated before genome publication; otherwise, primary genome report. Mandatory for MIGS of bacteria and archaea.

FIELD.LABEL: annotation source
FIELD.NAME: annotation source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For cases where annotation was provided by a community jamboree or model organism database rather than by a specific submitter

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the material separation to recover the nucleic acid fraction from a sample

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the enzymatic amplification (PCR, TMA, NASBA) of specific nucleic acids

FIELD.LABEL: library size
FIELD.NAME: library size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project

FIELD.LABEL: library reads sequenced
FIELD.NAME: library reads sequenced
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones sequenced from the library

FIELD.LABEL: library vector
FIELD.NAME: library vector
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Cloning vector type(s) used in construction of libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library screening strategy
FIELD.NAME: library screening strategy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating clone libraries in order to select a specific group of sequences

FIELD.LABEL: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.NAME: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Molecular barcodes, called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: adapters
FIELD.NAME: adapters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: sequencing method
FIELD.NAME: sequencing method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequencing machine used. Where possible the term should be taken from the OBI list of DNA sequencers (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0400103).

FIELD.LABEL: relevant electronic resources
FIELD.NAME: relevant electronic resources
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise associated to the sequence in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

FIELD.LABEL: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.NAME: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Standard operating procedures used in assembly and/or annotation of genomes, metagenomes or environmental sequences in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

FIELD.LABEL: number of standard tRNAs extracted
FIELD.NAME: number of standard tRNAs extracted
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total number of tRNAs identified from the bin, SAG or MAG

FIELD.LABEL: assembly software
FIELD.NAME: assembly software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool(s) used for assembly, including version number and parameters in the format {software};{version};{parameters} e.g. metaSPAdes;3.11.0;kmer set 21,33,55,77,99,121, default parameters otherwise

FIELD.LABEL: feature prediction
FIELD.NAME: feature prediction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Method used to predict UViGs features such as ORFs, integration site, etc. Add names and versions of software(s), parameters used

FIELD.LABEL: reference database(s)
FIELD.NAME: reference database(s)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: List of database(s) used for ORF annotation, along with version number and reference to website or publication

FIELD.LABEL: similarity search method
FIELD.NAME: similarity search method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool used to compare ORFs with database, along with version and cutoffs used. Add names and versions of software(s), parameters used

FIELD.LABEL: 16S recovered
FIELD.NAME: 16S recovered
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Can a 16S gene be recovered from the submitted bin, SAG or MAG?

FIELD.LABEL: 16S recovery software
FIELD.NAME: 16S recovery software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tools used for 16S rRNA gene extraction. Add names and versions of software(s), parameters used

FIELD.LABEL: tRNA extraction software
FIELD.NAME: tRNA extraction software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tools used for tRNA identification. Add names and versions of software(s), parameters used

FIELD.LABEL: completeness score
FIELD.NAME: completeness score
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Completeness score is typically based on either the fraction of markers found as compared to a database or the percent of a genome found as compared to a closely related reference genome. Completeness score is one of 3 attributes which in combination reflect the standard quality of a MAG, see here for more information: https://ena-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/faq_metagenomes.html.

FIELD.LABEL: completeness software
FIELD.NAME: completeness software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tools used for completion estimate, i.e. checkm, anvi'o, busco

FIELD.LABEL: completeness approach
FIELD.NAME: completeness approach
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The approach used to determine the completeness of a given bin, SAG or MAG, which would typically make use of a set of conserved marker genes or a closely related reference genome. For UViG completeness, include reference genome or group used, and contig feature suggesting a complete genome

FIELD.LABEL: contamination score
FIELD.NAME: contamination score
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The contamination score is based on the fraction of single-copy genes that are observed more than once in a query genome. Contamination score is one of 3 attributes which in combination reflect the standard quality of a MAG, see here for more information: https://ena-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/faq_metagenomes.html. If contamination ≥ 10% then please submit as a binned assembly.

FIELD.LABEL: contamination screening input
FIELD.NAME: contamination screening input
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of sequence data used as input

FIELD.LABEL: contamination screening parameters
FIELD.NAME: contamination screening parameters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specific parameters used in the decontamination sofware, such as reference database, coverage, and kmers. Combinations of these parameters may also be used, i.e. kmer and coverage, or reference database and kmer

FIELD.LABEL: decontamination software
FIELD.NAME: decontamination software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool(s) used in contamination screening

FIELD.LABEL: binning software
FIELD.NAME: binning software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool(s) used for the extraction of genomes from metagenomic datasets, where possible include a product ID (PID) of the tool(s) used. E.g. MetaCluster-TA (RRID:SCR_004599) or MaxBin (biotools:maxbin)

FIELD.LABEL: reassembly post binning
FIELD.NAME: reassembly post binning
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Has an assembly been performed on a genome bin extracted from a metagenomic assembly?

FIELD.LABEL: MAG coverage software
FIELD.NAME: MAG coverage software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool(s) used to determine the genome coverage if coverage is used as a binning parameter in the extraction of genomes from metagenomic datasets e.g. bwa, bbmap, bowtie, other

FIELD.LABEL: assembly quality
FIELD.NAME: assembly quality
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Assembly quality is one of 3 attributes which in combination reflect the standard quality of a MAG, see here for more information: https://ena-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/faq_metagenomes.html. Assembly statistics include, but are not limited to total assembly size, number of contigs, contig N50/L50, and maximum contig length.

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: Many fragments with little to no review of assembly other than reporting of standard assembly statistics
Multiple fragments where gaps span repetitive regions. Presence of the 23S, 16S, and 5S rRNA genes and at least 18 tRNAs
Single contiguous sequence without gaps or ambiguities with a consensus error rate equivalent to Q50 or better

FIELD.LABEL: binning parameters
FIELD.NAME: binning parameters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The parameters that have been applied during the extraction of genomes from metagenomic datasets e.g. coverage and kmer

FIELD.LABEL: taxonomic identity marker
FIELD.NAME: taxonomic identity marker
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The phylogenetic marker(s) used to assign an organism name to the bin, SAG or MAG. Examples are 16S gene, multi-marker approach or other e.g. rpoB gene

FIELD.LABEL: taxonomic classification
FIELD.NAME: taxonomic classification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Method used for taxonomic classification, along with reference database used, classification rank, and thresholds used to classify new genomes. Expected values are: classification method, database name, and other parameters e.g. vConTACT vContact2 (references from NCBI RefSeq v83, genus rank classification, default parameters)

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Collection event information

FIELD.LABEL: isolation_source
FIELD.NAME: isolation_source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived

FIELD.LABEL: collection date
FIELD.NAME: collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The date of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

FIELD.LABEL: altitude
FIELD.NAME: altitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

FIELD.LABEL: depth
FIELD.NAME: depth
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The vertical distance below local surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.

FIELD.LABEL: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.NAME: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: local environmental context
FIELD.NAME: local environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for "broad-scale environmental context". Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: environmental medium
FIELD.NAME: environmental medium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).

FIELD.LABEL: elevation
FIELD.NAME: elevation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: source material identifiers
FIELD.NAME: source material identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).

FIELD.LABEL: sample material processing
FIELD.NAME: sample material processing
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A brief description of any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment, or a link to the relevant protocol(s) performed.

FIELD.LABEL: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.NAME: amount or size of sample collected
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected.

FIELD.LABEL: size fraction selected
FIELD.NAME: size fraction selected
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Filtering pore size used in sample preparation e.g. 0-0.22 micrometer

FIELD.LABEL: sample derived from
FIELD.NAME: sample derived from
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to parental sample(s) or original run(s) that the assembly is derived from. The referenced samples or runs should already be registered in INSDC. This should be formatted as one of the following. A single sample/run e.g. ERSxxxxxx OR a comma separated list e.g. ERSxxxxxx,ERSxxxxxx OR a range e.g. ERSxxxxxx-ERSxxxxxx

FIELD.LABEL: metagenomic source
FIELD.NAME: metagenomic source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The metagenomic source of the sample. This value should contain “metagenome” and be in the taxonomy database e.g. wastewater metagenome or human gut metagenome. Please note “metagenome” alone will not be accepted. Check here for more details on metagenome taxonomy: https://ena-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/faq_taxonomy.html#environmental-taxonomic-classifications

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection device
FIELD.NAME: sample collection device
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The device used to collect an environmental sample. It is recommended to use terms listed under environmental sampling device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO) and/or terms listed under specimen collection device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0002094).

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection method
FIELD.NAME: sample collection method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method employed for collecting the sample. Can be provided in the form of a PMID, DOI, url or text.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: organism characteristics

FIELD.LABEL: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.NAME: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: ENA mutagenesis by carcinogen treatment checklist
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: ENA mutagenesis by carcinogen treatment checklist
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: Minimum Information required for reporting samples associated with genomic data, derived from carcinogen induced animal tumours. This minimum metadata standard was developed in collaboration with Duncan Odom lab for the Mouse Liver Cancer Evolution Project.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Part and developmental stage of organism
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Anatomical and developmental descriptions of the sample site or source material

FIELD.LABEL: tissue_type
FIELD.NAME: tissue_type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: tissue type from which the sample was obtained

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Organism characteristics
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Characteristics of the source organism

FIELD.LABEL: sex
FIELD.NAME: sex
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: sex of the organism from which the sample was obtained

FIELD.LABEL: date of birth
FIELD.NAME: date of birth
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Date of birth of subject the sample was derived from.

FIELD.LABEL: date of death
FIELD.NAME: date of death
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Date of death of subject the sample was derived from.

FIELD.LABEL: diagnosis
FIELD.NAME: diagnosis
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation (http://ncicb.nci.nih.gov/xml/owl/EVS/Thesaurus.owl#C15220).

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Infraspecies information
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Formal and informal infraspecies taxonomic information

FIELD.LABEL: strain
FIELD.NAME: strain
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the strain from which the sample was obtained.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: other

FIELD.LABEL: tumor grading (OBI_0600002)
FIELD.NAME: tumor grading (OBI_0600002)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Determination of the grade (severity/stage) of a tumor sample, used in cancer biology to describe abnormalities/qualities of tumor cells or tissues. Values can be described by terms from NCI Thesaurus.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: treatment
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Details of a treatment regime with a treatment agent.

FIELD.LABEL: treatment agent
FIELD.NAME: treatment agent
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the treatment agent used.

FIELD.LABEL: treatment dose
FIELD.NAME: treatment dose
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The dose of the treatment agent used.

FIELD.LABEL: treatment date
FIELD.NAME: treatment date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The date of the treatment applied.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Reference

FIELD.LABEL: Further Details
FIELD.NAME: Further Details
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference details related to a sample in form of an URI.

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: Crop Plant sample enhanced annotation checklist
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: ENA Crop Plant sample enhanced annotation checklist
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: The ENA Crop sample enhanced checklist has been developed in collaboration with a number of EMBL-EBI teams to capture enriched annotation of published crop plant samples that lack sufficient reported metadata and are typically associated with systematic transcriptomic realignment-based analyses.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Part and developmental stage of organism
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Anatomical and developmental descriptions of the sample site or source material

FIELD.LABEL: cell_type
FIELD.NAME: cell_type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: cell type from which the sample was obtained

FIELD.LABEL: dev_stage
FIELD.NAME: dev_stage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: if the sample was obtained from an organism in a specific developmental stage, it is specified with this qualifier

FIELD.LABEL: organism part
FIELD.NAME: organism part
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The part of organism's anatomy or substance arising from an organism from which the biomaterial was derived, excludes cells.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: non-sample terms

FIELD.LABEL: ploidy
FIELD.NAME: ploidy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly). For terms, please select terms listed under class ploidy (PATO:001374) of Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), and for a browser of PATO (v 2018-03-27) please refer to http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

FIELD.LABEL: infect
FIELD.NAME: infect
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the disease causing/contaminating organism; the value can also be ‘control’.

FIELD.LABEL: protocol
FIELD.NAME: protocol
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The laboratory method used to reveal the presence of the sample sequenced in the experiment.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: initial time point
FIELD.NAME: initial time point
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The first time point measured at the start of some process.

FIELD.LABEL: growth condition
FIELD.NAME: growth condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A role that a material entity can play which enables particular conditions used to grow organisms or parts of the organism. This includes isolated environments such as cultures and open environments such as field studies.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Organism characteristics
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Characteristics of the source organism

FIELD.LABEL: genotype
FIELD.NAME: genotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: name or code for genotype of organism

FIELD.LABEL: sex
FIELD.NAME: sex
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: sex of the organism from which the sample was obtained

FIELD.LABEL: age
FIELD.NAME: age
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Age of the organism the sample was derived from.

FIELD.LABEL: genetic modification
FIELD.NAME: genetic modification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A genetic modification of the genome of an organism which may occur naturally by spontaneous mutation, or be introduced by some experimental means. Examples of genetic modification include specification of a transgene or the gene knocked-out or details of transient transfection.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: default

FIELD.LABEL: phenotype
FIELD.NAME: phenotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Where possible, please use the Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) to describe your phenotypes.

FIELD.LABEL: cellular component
FIELD.NAME: cellular component
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The part of a cell or its extracellular environment in which a gene product is located.

FIELD.LABEL: individual
FIELD.NAME: individual
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An individual used a specimen in an experiment, from which a material sample was derived.

FIELD.LABEL: disease staging
FIELD.NAME: disease staging
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The stage or progression of a disease in an organism. Includes pathological staging of cancers and other disease progression. E.g. Dukes C stage describing colon cancer (EFO_0000410).

FIELD.LABEL: immunoprecipitate
FIELD.NAME: immunoprecipitate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The precipitate antibody bound target molecules generated when precipitating an antigen out of a solution during the process of immunoprecipitation.

FIELD.LABEL: replicate
FIELD.NAME: replicate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A role played by a a biological sample in the context of an experiment where the intent is that biological or technical variation is measured.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Infraspecies information
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Formal and informal infraspecies taxonomic information

FIELD.LABEL: cultivar
FIELD.NAME: cultivar
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: cultivar (cultivated variety) of plant from which sample was obtained

FIELD.LABEL: ecotype
FIELD.NAME: ecotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: a population within a given species displaying genetically based, phenotypic traits that reflect adaptation to a local habitat.

FIELD.LABEL: cell_line
FIELD.NAME: cell_line
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: cell line from which the sample was obtained

FIELD.LABEL: strain
FIELD.NAME: strain
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the strain from which the sample was obtained.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: treatment
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Details of a treatment regime with a treatment agent.

FIELD.LABEL: time
FIELD.NAME: time
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The duration in which the treatment has occurred.

FIELD.LABEL: dose
FIELD.NAME: dose
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total quantity or strength of a substance administered at one time.

FIELD.LABEL: chemical compound
FIELD.NAME: chemical compound
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A drug, solvent, chemical, etc., with a property that can be measured such as concentration (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/CHEBI_37577).

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: experimental factor and block
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: experimental factor and block

FIELD.LABEL: experimental factor 1
FIELD.NAME: experimental factor 1
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A variable that the experiment is based on.

FIELD.LABEL: experimental factor 2
FIELD.NAME: experimental factor 2
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A variable that the experiment is based on.

FIELD.LABEL: experimental factor 3
FIELD.NAME: experimental factor 3
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A variable that the experiment is based on.

FIELD.LABEL: experimental factor 4
FIELD.NAME: experimental factor 4
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A variable that the experiment is based on.

FIELD.LABEL: experimental factor 5
FIELD.NAME: experimental factor 5
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A variable that the experiment is based on.

FIELD.LABEL: block
FIELD.NAME: block
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A block or batch is an experimental unit arrangement into a group which is similar to one another. Typically, a blocking factor is a source of variability that is not of primary interest to the experimenter. An example of a blocking factor might be the sex of a patient; by blocking on sex, this source of variability is controlled for, thus leading to greater accuracy (EFO_0005067).

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions imposed

FIELD.LABEL: environmental stress
FIELD.NAME: environmental stress
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Environmental stress is a treatment where some aspect of the environment is perturbed in order to stress the organism or culture, e.g. change in temperature, change in watering regime.

FIELD.LABEL: environmental history
FIELD.NAME: environmental history
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Information concerning the envinonrment a material entity has been exposed to, such as an organism from a lake.

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: ENA parasite sample checklist
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: ENA parasite sample checklist
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: Minimum information about parasite samples. A checklist for reporting metadata of parasite samples associated with molecular data. This standard was developed by the COMPARE platform and can be used for submission of sample metadata derived from protozoan parasites (e.g. Cryptosporidium) and also multicellular eukaryotic parasites (e.g. Platyhelminthes and Nematoda).

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Part and developmental stage of organism
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Anatomical and developmental descriptions of the sample site or source material

FIELD.LABEL: dev_stage
FIELD.NAME: dev_stage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: if the sample was obtained from an organism in a specific developmental stage, it is specified with this qualifier

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Human surveillance data
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Information associated with a human influenza surveillance sample.

FIELD.LABEL: subject exposure
FIELD.NAME: subject exposure
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Exposure of the subject to infected human or animals, such as poultry, wild bird or swine. If multiple exposures are applicable, please state them separated by semicolon. Example: poultry; wild bird

FIELD.LABEL: subject exposure duration
FIELD.NAME: subject exposure duration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Duration of the exposure of the subject to an infected human or animal. If multiple exposures are applicable, please state their duration in the same order in which you reported the exposure in the field 'subject exposure'. Example: 1 day; 0.33 days

FIELD.LABEL: travel-relation
FIELD.NAME: travel-relation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Designates the relation of the main diagnosis to the patient's travel.

FIELD.LABEL: clinical setting
FIELD.NAME: clinical setting
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The timing of the clinic visit in relation to travel.

FIELD.LABEL: country of travel
FIELD.NAME: country of travel
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the country of patient's travel.

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Collection event information

FIELD.LABEL: collection date
FIELD.NAME: collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The date of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Organism characteristics
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Characteristics of the source organism

FIELD.LABEL: genotype
FIELD.NAME: genotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: name or code for genotype of organism

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host disorder

FIELD.LABEL: host disease outcome
FIELD.NAME: host disease outcome
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Disease outcome in the host.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host description

FIELD.LABEL: host common name
FIELD.NAME: host common name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: common name of the host, e.g. human

FIELD.LABEL: host subject id
FIELD.NAME: host subject id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: a unique identifier by which each subject can be referred to, de-identified, e.g. #131

FIELD.LABEL: host age
FIELD.NAME: host age
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: age of host at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees

FIELD.LABEL: host health state
FIELD.NAME: host health state
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Health status of the host at the time of sample collection.

FIELD.LABEL: host sex
FIELD.NAME: host sex
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Gender or sex of the host.

FIELD.LABEL: host scientific name
FIELD.NAME: host scientific name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Scientific name of the natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which sample was obtained.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: General collection event information
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: General information on the collection event.

FIELD.LABEL: collector name
FIELD.NAME: collector name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the person who collected the specimen. Example: John Smith

FIELD.LABEL: collecting institution
FIELD.NAME: collecting institution
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the institution to which the person collecting the specimen belongs. Format: Institute Name, Institute Address

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage conditions
FIELD.NAME: sample storage conditions
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Conditions at which sample was stored, usually storage temperature, duration and location

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Infraspecies information
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Formal and informal infraspecies taxonomic information

FIELD.LABEL: isolate
FIELD.NAME: isolate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: individual isolate from which the sample was obtained

FIELD.LABEL: strain
FIELD.NAME: strain
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the strain from which the sample was obtained.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Associated host information
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Information regarding the data which is host associated

FIELD.LABEL: isolation source host-associated
FIELD.NAME: isolation source host-associated
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of host tissue or organ sampled for analysis. Example: tracheal tissue

FIELD.LABEL: diagnostic method
FIELD.NAME: diagnostic method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method or procedure (imaging, genetic or other) performed to determine or confirm the presence of disease in an individual. Examples: microscopy, immunofluorescence, PCR, rapid tests, etc.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: organism characteristics

FIELD.LABEL: known pathogenicity
FIELD.NAME: known pathogenicity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: To what is the entity pathogenic, for instance plant, fungi, bacteria

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Environmental information
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Environmental information if not host associated.

FIELD.LABEL: isolation source non-host-associated
FIELD.NAME: isolation source non-host-associated
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived. Example: soil

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: UniEuk_EukBank
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: ENA UniEuk_EukBank Checklist
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: Minimum information required for reporting samples associated with the UniEuk EukBank initiative. This checklist aims to capture contextual metadata associated with V4 18S SSU rRNA molecular data.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Marine Sample

FIELD.LABEL: Size Fraction Lower Threshold
FIELD.NAME: Size Fraction Lower Threshold
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: SAMPLE_PROTOCOL_Size-Fraction_Lower-Threshold_(µm) indicates the lower size threshold. Materials smaller than the size threshold are excluded from the sample. Example: 0.22 µm

FIELD.LABEL: Size Fraction Upper Threshold
FIELD.NAME: Size Fraction Upper Threshold
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: SAMPLE_PROTOCOL_Size-Fraction_Upper-Threshold_(µm) indicates the upper size threshold. Materials larger than the size threshold are excluded from the sample.Example: 1.6 µm

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: non-sample terms

FIELD.LABEL: target gene
FIELD.NAME: target gene
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies

FIELD.LABEL: target subfragment
FIELD.NAME: target subfragment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to e.g. identify special regions on marker genes like V6 on 16S rRNA

FIELD.LABEL: pcr primers
FIELD.NAME: pcr primers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Collection event information

FIELD.LABEL: isolation_source
FIELD.NAME: isolation_source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived

FIELD.LABEL: collected_by
FIELD.NAME: collected_by
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: name of persons or institute who collected the specimen

FIELD.LABEL: collection date
FIELD.NAME: collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The date of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

FIELD.LABEL: altitude
FIELD.NAME: altitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

FIELD.LABEL: depth
FIELD.NAME: depth
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The vertical distance below local surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.

FIELD.LABEL: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.NAME: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: local environmental context
FIELD.NAME: local environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for "broad-scale environmental context". Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: environmental medium
FIELD.NAME: environmental medium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection device or method
FIELD.NAME: sample collection device or method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method or deviced employed for collecting the sample

FIELD.LABEL: environmental_sample
FIELD.NAME: environmental_sample
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: identifies sequences derived by direct molecular isolation from a bulk environmental DNA sample (by PCR with or without subsequent cloning of the product, DGGE, or other anonymous methods) with no reliable identification of the source organism

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Marine Environment

FIELD.LABEL: Salinity
FIELD.NAME: Salinity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total concentration of all dissolved salts in a liquid or solid sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Reference

DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: Marine microalgae contextual information. The checklist has been developed in collaboration with EMBRIC Project partners and is suitable for reporting metadata related to environmental samples and those in culture collections.

If available, provide both dates.

FIELD_GROUP.NAME: default

FIELD.NAME: gender

FIELD.NAME: phenotype

FIELD.NAME: sample type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Affected organ

FIELD.LABEL: PPCG ID
FIELD.NAME: PPCG ID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Pan Prostate Cancer Group participant ID

FIELD.LABEL: PPCG sample ID
FIELD.NAME: PPCG sample ID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Pan Prostate Cancer Group sample ID. This is an extension of the participant ID: As a different sample is added from an individual a letter is added to the identifier in alphanumeric order. E.g., for PPCG ID P0076 the first sample ID would be PPCG0076a and then PPCG0076b, PPCG0076c and so on. At the end of each sample ID please always add whether the sample is DNA or RNA. Therefore, naming should look like either PPCG0076b_DNA for DNA samples or PPCG0076b_RNA for RNA samples

FIELD.LABEL: Pipeline/UUID
FIELD.NAME: Pipeline/UUID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique sample identifier used within various pipeline groups - used to avoid sample ID clash when pipeline results are merged.

FIELD.LABEL: preservation
FIELD.NAME: preservation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Type of sample preservation

FIELD.LABEL: xenograft
FIELD.NAME: xenograft
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A tissue graft or organ transplant from a donor

In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

FIELD.LABEL: original geographic location
FIELD.NAME: original geographic location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For use if the specimen is from a zoo, botanic garden or culture collection etc. and has a known origin elsewhere. Please record the general description of the original collection location. This should be formatted as a country and optionally include more specific locations ranging from least to most specific separated by a | character, e.g. “United Kingdom | East Anglia | Norfolk | Norwich | University of East Anglia | UEA Broad".

FIELD.LABEL: original geographic location (longitude)

This should be formatted as one of the following. A single sample/run e.g. ERSxxxxxx OR a comma separated list e.g. ERSxxxxxx,ERSxxxxxx OR a range e.g. ERSxxxxxx-ERSxxxxxx

FIELD.LABEL: sample same as
FIELD.NAME: sample same as

FIELD.LABEL: proxy voucher
FIELD.NAME: proxy voucher
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For use if voucher material needs to be made from a specimen that is different than the one submitted for sequencing. Please record the unique identifier that references the physical specimen and that ideally exists in a curated collection. The ID should have the following structure: name of the institution (institution code) followed by the collection code (if available) and the voucher id (institution_code:collection_code:voucher_id)

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Infraspecies information
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Formal and informal infraspecies taxonomic information

FIELD.LABEL: culture_or_strain_id
FIELD.NAME: culture_or_strain_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: living, culturable, named laboratory strain that sequenced material is derived from.
